text: At-home fitness startup Peloton Interactive's shares fell 33% on Friday, wiping off about $9 billion in market value. This erased most of the gains Peloton witnessed during the height of COVID-19 pandemic. The development came after the company cut its annual sales forecast by up to $1 billion, saying demand for exercise bikes and treadmills was slowing faster than expected.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Uber reports its first ever operating profit of $8 million
text: Uber has reported its first profitable quarter on an adjusted basis since it launched more than a decade ago. It posted an adjusted EBITDA profit of $8 million for the quarter ended September, as compared with a loss of $625 million a year ago. Uber's net loss stood at $2.4 billion, mostly due to a massive drop in DiDi's value.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Will boost consumption and keep inflation low: Fin Min on excise duty cut
text: After the Centre announced reduction in excise duty on petrol and diesel by ₹5 and ₹10 respectively, the Finance Ministry said the move will boost consumption and keep inflation low. "The massive reduction in excise on diesel will come as a boost to the farmers during the upcoming Rabi season," it added. The new rates will be effective from Thursday.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Air India has dues of ₹2,000 cr related to landing, parking: AAI chief
text: Airports Authority of India (AAI) Chairman Sanjeev Kumar said that Air India has to pay outstanding dues of ₹2,000 crore to the AAI, related to landing, parking and other charges. "Apart from Air India, no significant dues from other airlines are pending," he added. "We are fairly confident that we would recover the past dues from them," Kumar said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: SBI ex-Chairman Chaudhuri hospitalised with restlessness: Report
text: SBI's former Chairman Pratip Chaudhuri, who was arrested on Monday in an alleged loan scam case, has been admitted to a hospital, according to reports. Chaudhuri was reportedly hospitalised on Wednesday after he complained of restlessness and hypertension. He was sent to 14-day judicial custody for allegedly selling a hotel property to an asset reconstruction company at a throwaway price.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Evergrande sold 2 private jets to raise $50 mn last month: Report
text: China Evergrande Group raised more than $50 million last month by selling two of its private jets, The Wall Street Journal reported. The Gulfstream jets were reportedly bought by American aircraft investors. It was earlier reported that Evergrande's billionaire Founder Hui Ka Yan has been urged by authorities to use his own wealth to help solve the company's debt crisis.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Covaxin gets WHO approval for Emergency Use Listing
text: The World Health Organization has said it has accepted Bharat Biotech's Covaxin for Emergency Use Listing. This comes after WHO's technical advisory group last week asked for additional clarifications from Bharat Biotech for its COVID-19 vaccine to conduct a final emergency use listing "risk-benefit assessment". WHO had earlier said that it "trusts the Indian industry" after delay in approval.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Govt reduces excise duty on petrol and diesel by ₹5 and ₹10 effective tomorrow
text: The government on the eve of Diwali announced central excise duty on petrol and diesel will be reduced by ₹5 and ₹10 respectively, effective Thursday. The states were urged to reduce VAT on petrol and diesel to give relief to consumers. Fuel prices were increased for the seventh straight day on Tuesday, following which petrol price crossed ₹110/litre in Delhi.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Delhi govt to launch 'Delhi Bazaar' e-portal for businesses to sell products globally
text: Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has announced that the Delhi government will launch 'Delhi Bazaar', a web portal for businessmen, industrialists and professionals through which they can sell their products across the world. This is a "first-of-its-kind" portal where all of Delhi's products and services will be available, Kejriwal said. This will boost Delhi's GDP rapidly, the CM added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Covaxin's shelf life extended to up to 12 months from the date of manufacture
text: Bharat Biotech announced the Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation has approved the extension of the shelf life of its COVID-19 vaccine Covaxin up to 12 months from the date of manufacture. "This decision is based on the availability of additional stability data," the company said. Until now, Covaxin's sale and distribution were allowed with a shelf life of six months.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: US startup says it applied for 'Meta' trademark before Facebook, seeks $20 million
text: US-based startup Meta PCs Co-founder Zach Shutt has said his company had filed for the 'Meta' trademark in August, months before Facebook changed its company's name to 'Meta'. According to trademark filings, the company, which sells computers, first began using the brand for its products in November 2020. Shutt said he'll stand down if CEO Mark Zuckerberg pays $20 million.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Bezos, girlfriend buy 14-acre property on Hawaiian island for ₹580 crore: Report
text: World's second-richest person Jeff Bezos and his girlfriend Lauren Sánchez have reportedly bought a 14-acre property on the Hawaiian island of Maui for $78 million (around ₹580 crore). The campus comes with a 4,500-square-foot main house, a 1,700-square-foot guesthouse, some other buildings and a circular swimming pool. There is also an outdoor kitchen with ocean views off the main house.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Govt says buy only hallmarked gold jewellery on Diwali, lists 3 things to check
text: Ahead of Diwali, the Centre issued an advisory asking customers to ensure that they buy only hallmarked jewellery. The hallmarked gold jewellery artefacts consist of three marks - Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) logo, purity in carat and fineness for gold and a unique six-digit alphanumeric code, it said. If "hallmark isn't clearly visible...ask for a magnifying glass", it added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: 2070 far away, but target a big deal: Mahindra on PM's carbon emissions pledge
text: Responding to PM Narendra Modi's commitment towards net-zero carbon emissions by 2070, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra said, "2070 sounds far away. But this target is a big deal and won't be easy." "The fact that we showed up at Glasgow (unlike some other large emitters!) and listed 5 clear and tough commitments is of enormous impact. Proud," he added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Always tell my daughters to ensure they're paid as much as male colleagues: Nooyi
text: Former PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi told Moneycontrol that she keeps telling both her daughters, who are working, "to make sure they are paid at parity with their male counterparts". "I always tell them, if you're not, you better...ask for it. Because there's no way you shouldn't be paid as much as the men are for the same job," Nooyi said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Pics show damage caused to huge container ship that blocked Suez Canal for 6 days
text: Pictures of the huge container ship Ever Given have revealed the damage its bow suffered after blocking Suez Canal for six days in March. The damage is so extensive that there's a "whole new lower bow section in the yard prepared", Salvatore Mercogliano, a maritime historian, said. The ship, which weighs over 2,00,000 tonnes, is dry-docked in China for repairs.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: India's services activity grows at fastest pace in 10.5 years in October
text: India's services sector activity grew at its strongest pace in 10.5 years in October on improved domestic demand despite high inflation, a private survey revealed. The IHS Markit Services Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) rose to 58.4 in October, remaining above the 50-mark threshold, that separates expansion from contraction, for the third straight month. This figure was at 55.2 in September.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Goldman Sachs promotes record 643 executives, including 29 from Bengaluru, as MDs
text: Goldman Sachs has announced that 643 executives will be promoted as managing directors from January 1, 2022. Of this, 29 new MDs will be from Bengaluru, 80 from the Asia-Pacific region, 151 from Europe, the Middle East and Africa (EMEA) and 383 from the Americas. "Our 2021 class is the largest and most diverse class in our history," it added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Largest shipping company Maersk sees its most profitable quarter in 117 years
text: World's largest shipping company Maersk posted its most profitable quarter in its 117-year history on Tuesday as the Danish company more than quadrupled its operating profits to $5.9 billion in its third quarter. The shipping company benefited from record shipping rates as port delays snarled the supply chain amid COVID-19. To meet growing demand, Maersk said it added more capacity.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Air Canada suspends over 800 unvaccinated employees: Report
text: Canada's largest airline Air Canada has suspended more than 800 employees for not being fully vaccinated against COVID-19, Global News reported. "Employees who aren't vaccinated or don't have...medical or...permitted exemption have been put on unpaid leave," Air Canada's deputy CEO Michael Russo said, as quoted by Global News. Over 96% of the airline's employees are fully vaccinated, it added.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Ether jumps to record high, hits $4,643
text: Ether, the second-largest cryptocurrency, rose to as high as $4,643, hitting an all-time high. After hitting the mark, the cryptocurrency was up more than 530% year-to-date, CoinDesk data showed. It had rallied by more than 6% within 24 hours. Last month, Ether had soared above $4,403.93 after gaining 3.5%, surpassing the previous record of $4,379.62 it hit in May.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: 140 mn people spent $9.7 bn using China's digital currency: PBOC
text: Around 140 million people have used China's digital currency for transactions totalling around $9.7 billion, Chinese central bank PBOC official said. Mu Changchun, the director-general of PBOC's Digital Currency Institute, said there was no official launch date for eCNY.  Mu added that so far 1.55 million merchants have the ability to accept payments using eCNY wallets.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Thai crypto exchange turns unicorn, its coin jumps 200%
text: Thailand-based crypto exchange Bitkub Online's coin surged 200% after nation's Siam Commercial Bank said it will acquire 51% of the exchange. The exchange was valued at over $1 billion. Thailand's King Maha Vajiralongkorn holds a majority stake in the Siam Commercial Bank. Shares of the bank rose as much as 3.5% to a six-week high.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Policybazaar IPO subscribed 16.59 times on final day
text: The initial public offering (IPO) of PB Fintech, the parent of Policybazaar and Paisabazaar, was subscribed 16.59 times on its third and final day of bidding. It received bids for 57.23 crore equity shares against its offer size of 3.45 crore equity shares. The retail portion was subscribed 3.31 times, whereas that of institutional investors was subscribed 24.89 times.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Freshworks posts $107 mn loss in 1st quarterly report after US IPO
text: US-headquartered software company Freshworks has reported a loss of $107.4 million in its first quarterly report since US listing. Freshworks revenue was $96.6 million for the September 2021 quarter, up 46% year-on-year, from $66.18 million. It expects to close fourth quarter with $99-104 million in revenue and expects its 2021 revenue to be $364.5 million-$366.5 million.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Centre releases ₹17,000 crore as GST compensation to states, UTs
text: The Finance Ministry has released ₹17,000 crore as GST compensation to states and Union Territories (UTs) with legislature. With this, the total amount of compensation released to the states and Union Territories so far in 2021-22 is ₹60,000 crore, the ministry said. Maharashtra will receive the highest GST compensation of ₹3,053.6 crore, followed by Karnataka, which will get ₹1,602.06 crore.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Hindalco to buy Polycab's subsidiary Ryker for ₹323 cr enterprise value
text: Kumar Mangalam Birla-controlled Hindalco Industries on Wednesday announced the acquisition of 100% equity stake in Polycab India's subsidiary Ryker Base. The acquisition will be done through Hindalco's wholly-owned subsidiary Renuka Investments & Finance and purchase consideration for the stake is based on an enterprise value of ₹323 crore. Hindalco is the country's largest copper producer.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Birla may invest at least $150 million in Vodafone Idea: Report
text: Aditya Birla Group Chairman Kumar Mangalam Birla is close to investing at least $150 million in Vodafone Idea (Vi) in his personal capacity, Mint reported. An issue of fresh convertibles or equities is being considered for the investment plan, the report added. Birla's investment aims to enhance investor confidence and help the company meet immediate working capital needs, it said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Pratip Chaudhuri's arrest extremely unfortunate: SBI Chairman
text: SBI's Chairman Dinesh Kumar Khara on Wednesday said that the recent arrest of former SBI Chairman Pratip Chaudhuri was "extremely unfortunate". "It appears that he was not given an opportunity to be heard before issuing the arrest warrant," Khara added. Chaudhuri was arrested for alleged sale of a non-performing asset to Alchemist ARC at a low value.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: SBI shares hit record high after it posts highest-ever quarterly profit
text: Shares of State Bank of India (SBI) surged as much as 4% to hit record high of ₹542 after it reported highest-ever quarterly profit in July-September period. SBI's standalone profit in the quarter rose by 66.7% to ₹7,627 crore from ₹4,574.16 crore in the year-ago period. SBI's total deposits during the period grew at 9.77% to ₹38.09 lakh crore.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Need better laws to protect bonafide banking decisions: Kotak on SBI ex-chief's arrest
text: Kotak Mahindra Bank's MD Uday Kotak has said the country needs a more efficient criminal justice system that protects bonafide banking or lending decisions. This comes days after Jaisalmer Police arrested former SBI Chairman Pratip Chaudhuri in an alleged loan scam case. He was arrested for alleged sale of a non-performing asset to Alchemist ARC at a low value.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Cairn Energy enters undertakings with India to end retro tax dispute
text: Cairn Energy said it had entered into certain undertakings with the Indian government which would allow for the refund of taxes to settle the tax dispute. Cairn added that it would start filing the necessary documents and work with India to expedite the refund of nearly ₹7,900 crore. The Parliament had passed a bill to end retrospective tax in August.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: IRCTC has full powers in deciding convenience fee rate: CMD
text: IRCTC's Chairman and MD Rajni Hasija said the company's management has full powers to decide the rate at which the convenience fee can be charged. "This power was delegated to IRCTC in 2019, when...convenience fee was restored," she added. Last week, the Railways Ministry had asked IRCTC to share 50% of convenience fee and later withdrew the decision.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Can meet Musk anywhere in 'space or on Earth' to discuss world hunger: UN official
text: UN World Food Programme's Chief David Beasley said he's ready to meet Elon Musk "anywhere - Earth or space" to explain how he could help alleviate hunger. "I suggest [meeting] in the field where you can see WFP's...processes and...technology at work," he added. Earlier, Musk said he'd donate $6 billion if UN can explain how that would solve world hunger.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Nike files 'virtual goods' trademarks in US, reportedly indicates 'metaverse' entry
text: Nike has filed seven requests with US Patent and Trademark Office for trademarks in categories including "downloadable virtual goods" or programs featuring shoes, apparel for use online. It filed new applications for 'Nike', 'Just Do It' and its logo. Reports said Nike may be heading into the 'metaverse'. A trademark attorney said the filings were "a nod to this idea".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Snowden warns against investing in Shiba Inu, calls it 'clone of dog money'
text: US whistleblower Edward Snowden has warned investors against investing their hard-earned money in the Shiba Inu meme token. He tweeted that it's "not even dog money but a CLONE of dog money." On Monday, Shiba Inu cryptocurrency surpassed the market capitalisation of Dogecoin, making it the 10th biggest cryptocurrency by market capitalisation.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Squid Game-inspired crypto collapses in apparent scam, creators vanish with ₹25 crore
text: Netflix show 'Squid Game' inspired cryptocurrency 'SQUID' plunged from its peak price of $2,861 to $0 in an apparent scam. Reports said the token's creators "rug pulled" SQUID holders by quickly cashing out their coins for real money, draining the liquidity pool from the exchange. The cryptocurrency's website disappeared, with SQUID's creators making off with $3.3 million (around ₹25 crore).
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Yahoo quits China citing 'challenging' business environment
text: Yahoo said it's pulling out of China and its services won't be accessible from mainland China as of November 1, citing an "increasingly challenging business and legal environment". Yahoo is the second large US technology firm after LinkedIn to reduce its operations in China in recent weeks. Yahoo previously downsized operations in China by shutting its Beijing office in 2015.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: UPI transactions touch $100 billion for 1st time in India in October
text: The value of Unified Payments Interface (UPI) transactions hit $100 billion for the first time in October, as per data released by the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI). Around 4.2 billion UPI transactions amounting to $103 billion (₹7.7 lakh crore) took place during the month. The value rose by 18% from $87.5 billion (₹6.54 lakh crore) in September.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: 2021's festive season worst in a decade for automobile sales, says FADA
text: Chip shortage and subdued demand due to the pandemic have hit automobile sales, making 2021's festive season the worst in a decade for automobile sales, the Federation of Automobile Dealers Associations (FADA) said on Tuesday. FADA President Vinkesh Gulati tweeted sales figures for October 2021 and October 2020. The figures showed a double-digit contraction in October 2021 in two-wheeler sales.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Delhivery files papers for ₹7,460-crore IPO
text: Logistics startup Delhivery has filed draft papers with SEBI to raise ₹7,460 crore through an initial public offering. The IPO will consist of a fresh issue worth ₹5,000 crore and an offer for sale of shares worth ₹2,460 crore, filings revealed. The 10-year-old startup, backed by Carlyle, SoftBank and Tiger Global, is reportedly seeking a valuation of over ₹41,000 crore.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: No contract signed with Hertz yet for 1,00,000 cars: Musk as Tesla shares surge
text: Billionaire Elon Musk has said Tesla hasn't yet signed a contract with Hertz, despite an announcement by the American car rental company on October 25 that it ordered 1,00,000 Teslas. He was responding to a tweet showing a chart of Tesla's rising stock price. Tesla's market value had surpassed $1 trillion for the first time after news of Hertz's order.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Delhivery's IPO filing reveals salaries of CEO, top executives
text: Delhivery's DRHP for ₹7,460 crore initial public offering revealed that Co-founder and CEO Sahil Barua received ₹4.3 crore as remuneration for financial year ended March 2021. The ten-year-old logistics startup's Co-founder and CTO Kapil Bharati earned ₹3.9 crore, whereas CBO Sandeep Kumar Barasia earned ₹12.9 crore during the same period. Further, Delhivery COO Ajith Pai earned ₹11.8 crore.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Ola reports its first-ever operating profit of ₹89.82 crore
text: Ola has reported its first-ever operating profit since beginning operations in 2010, company documents showed on Tuesday. Ola reported a standalone operating profit or EBITDA of ₹89.82 crore for the fiscal year that ended in March 2021, versus a loss of ₹610 crore a year ago. Despite COVID-19 slowing revenues, Ola turned profitable by aggressive cost cuts and workforce reduction.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Taliban bans use of foreign currencies in Afghanistan, citing economic situation
text: Taliban has announced a complete ban on the use of foreign currencies in Afghanistan. "The economic situation and national interests in the country require that all Afghans use Afghan currency in their every trade," Taliban spokesman Zabihullah Mujahid said. The Afghani had fallen to a record low after Taliban seized power in the country in August.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Expect India, others to make decision on vaccine within weeks: Novavax CEO
text: Novavax CEO Stanley Erck has said that the firm expects regulators in India, the Philippines and other nations to make a decision on its COVID-19 vaccine within weeks. This comes after the firm's vaccine received its first emergency use authorisation (EUA) from Indonesia. The vaccine doses for Indonesia will be manufactured by the Serum Institute of India (SII).
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Tesla stock falls 4% as Musk says no contract signed with Hertz
text: Tesla shares fell 4-5% on Tuesday after its CEO Elon Musk said the company has not yet signed a contract with the American car rental company Hertz for 100,000 Tesla cars. Hertz later told Bloomberg that it has started receiving deliveries of Tesla cars. The news of the biggest-ever order had earlier helped Tesla breach $1 trillion in market capitalisation.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Policybazaar's ₹5,700 crore IPO fully subscribed on day 2
text: The ₹5,700-crore initial public offering (IPO) of PB Fintech, which operates Policybazaar and Paisabazaar, was fully subscribed on the second day of bidding as it received bids for 5.47 crore equity shares against an IPO size of 3.45 crore equity shares. The retail portion of the IPO was subscribed 2.04 times, whereas that of non-institutional investors was subscribed 0.23 times.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Fino Payments Bank IPO subscribed 2.03 times on final day
text: The ₹1,200 crore initial public offering (IPO) of Fino Payments Bank was subscribed 2.03 times on the final day. The offer received bids for over 2.32 crore shares against the total issue size of 1.14 crore shares, BSE data showed. The portion reserved for retail investors was subscribed 5.92 times, while that of qualified institutional buyers was subscribed 1.65 times.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Kami named NZ's fastest-growing firm, gives employees $7,000 bonus
text: Digital classroom platform Kami surprised its 53 employees with a $7,000 bonus, after it was named the fastest-growing company in New Zealand. Founded in 2013 by students of The University of Auckland, Kami secured the number one spot in 2021 Deloitte Fast 50 index. The company registered a 1,177% growth in revenue over the past three years, according to Deloitte.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Amazon-backed EV startup Rivian seeks over $53 bn valuation in IPO
text: Amazon-backed electric vehicle (EV) startup Rivian is targeting a valuation of more than $53 billion in its initial public offering (IPO). Rivian plans to sell 135 million shares for $57 to $62 each. It is looking to raise up to $8.4 billion, setting it up to be the third-largest IPO by funds raised in the past decade in the US.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Major edible oil players cut wholesale prices by ₹4-7 a litre: Trade body
text: Major edible oil players, including Adani Wilmar and Ruchi Soya Industries, have cut wholesale prices by ₹4-7 per litre, Solvent Extractors' Association of India (SEA) said. Prices were reduced to give relief to consumers during the festival season, it added. World's edible oil supply situation is improving, which is likely to cool down international prices, SEA President Atul Chaturvedi said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: HC restrains generic pharma firms from making, selling Novartis' patent drug
text: The Delhi High Court has restrained various generic pharmaceutical companies from manufacturing and selling Valsartan and Sacubitril tablets as it may amount to patent infringement of Novartis. The combination of the two tablets is used for treatment of cardiovascular diseases. The injunction order was passed against Natco Pharma, Torrent Pharma, Eris Lifesciences and Windlas Biotech among others.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Sale of stressed assets by lenders must be done earlier: RBI report
text: Sale of stressed assets by lenders must be done at an earlier stage to allow for optimal recovery by asset reconstruction companies (ARCs), an RBI committee said in a report. "Providing additional funding to...stressed borrowers is...key requirement for reviving their businesses," it added. It also recommended that minimum net owned funds requirement for ARCs should be doubled to ₹200 crore.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Inflation remains a big concern going forward: Dabur India CEO
text: Dabur India CEO Mohit Malhotra has said that inflation is going to remain a big concern in the quarters ahead. "Inflation has been tough. We thought there will be softening of inflation in the third quarter," he said. "However, we haven't seen any signs of easing and the projections say...there might be a further increase going ahead," Malhotra added.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: CCI approves HDFC Life's acquisition of Exide Life for ₹6,687 crore
text: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) on Tuesday approved HDFC Life Insurance's acquisition of 100% shareholding in Exide Life Insurance for ₹6,687 crore. HDFC Life will pay ₹725.98 crore in cash and the rest by issuing 8.7 crore shares at ₹685 apiece to Exide Industries. Exide Life would be merged with HDFC Life after completion of the share acquisition.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: IL&FS resolves ₹52,200 cr debt, to address ₹4,800 cr more by March: Kotak
text: IL&FS has resolved ₹52,200 crore out of the targeted ₹61,000 crore debt resolution by the fiscal-end, its Chairman Uday Kotak said. IL&FS will address ₹4,800 crore more debt by the end of 2021-22, he added. The company is sitting on a cash balance of ₹16,700 crore as of end-October, when it completed the third year of its bankruptcy, Kotak said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: India unlikely to see demand for oil peaking before 2040: HPCL CMD
text: Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited's (HPCL) Chairman and MD Mukesh Surana said that India is unlikely to see demand for oil peaking before 2040. Other forms of energy will slowly and gradually find a place in the country's energy mix, he added. This comes after PM Narendra Modi said that India will achieve net-zero carbon emissions by 2070.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Haven't taken any call as yet: LIC Chairman on Zee-Invesco dispute
text: On being asked about the ongoing dispute between Zee Entertainment and Invesco, Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) Chairman MR Kumar said that he hasn't taken any call so far. LIC owns nearly 5% stake in Zee. He added that the insurer is watching the developments cautiously and a call will be taken on the matter at the right time.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: India's unemployment rate rises to 7.75% in October: CMIE
text: India's unemployment rate rose to 7.75% in October after falling to a three-month low of 6.86% in September, data from Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE) showed. Rural unemployment rose to 7.91% from 6.06% in September, whereas urban joblessness fell to 7.38%. Recently, IHS Markit's survey also revealed that jobs failed to increase in October despite improvement in operating conditions.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Reliance to open India's first open-air rooftop drive-in theatre in Mumbai
text: Reliance on Monday announced it will open what it claims to be India's first-ever open-air rooftop theatre, 'Jio Drive-in', in a shopping mall set to be launched by the company in Mumbai on November 5, 2021. Operated by PVR, the drive-in theatre will have a capacity of 290 cars. "It will have the biggest cinema screen in town," Reliance said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Moderna loses $3.2 bn in market cap after COVID-19 vaccine nod for teens delayed
text: Moderna lost over $3.2 billion in market value on Monday after the regulatory approval for its COVID-19 shot in teenagers aged 12-17 was delayed. The stock ended 2.3% lower at $337.17. The US Food and Drug Administration wants time to weigh risks of myocarditis in children and the review may not be completed before January 2022, Moderna said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: $6 bn won't solve world hunger but it will save 42 mn people: UN official to Musk
text: UN World Food Programme's Chief David Beasley responded to the world's richest person Elon Musk after Musk said he'd donate $6 billion if the UN can explain how the amount can solve world hunger. "$6 billion won't solve world hunger, but it WILL prevent geopolitical instability, mass migration and save 42 million people on the brink of starvation," tweeted David.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: App accuses Meta of copying its logo, shares image comparing the two logos
text: A Berlin-based migraine app has accused Mark Zuckerberg of copying the app's logo for Facebook's new company identity 'Meta'. The 'M-sense Migräne' app's Twitter handle tweeted, "We're honoured that Facebook felt inspired by our logo - maybe they'll get inspired by our data privacy procedures as well." The app helps users find the relevant triggers of their migraine attacks.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: TikTok owner ByteDance breaks China's '996' work culture, limits workday to 9 hrs
text: TikTok owner ByteDance has mandated its employees in China should only work from 10 am to 7 pm from Monday-Friday. They will need to seek permission to stay beyond these hours. ByteDance is one of the first technology companies to break China's '996' work culture that requires employees to work from 9 am to 9 pm, six days a week.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Coinbase to buy AI-driven platform Agara in its 1st startup acquisition in India
text: Cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase has announced that it's buying Agara, an AI-driven autonomous voice agent startup, in its first startup acquisition in India. The size of the deal for the four-year-old startup, which operates in India and the US, is reportedly $40-50 million. Coinbase India Site Lead Pankaj Gupta said he co-founded Agara in 2017 and left it to join Google.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: 'Squid Game' crypto that hit $2,862 after 2,30,000% gain now less than half a cent
text: Netflix show 'Squid Game' inspired cryptocurrency 'SQUID', that surged more than 2,30,000% in the past week to hit $2,861.80, plunged to less than half a cent as of Monday in New York. It plunged 99.99% in the last 24 hours. The cryptocurrency's website, which said, "please do your own due diligence and exercise extreme caution," is no longer accessible.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Can't tell the difference between iPhone 13 & iPhone 12: Apple Co-founder
text: Apple Co-founder Steve Wozniak said he got the new iPhone but "can't tell the difference" between iPhone 13 and its predecessor iPhone 12. "The software that's in it applies to older iPhones, I presume and that's the good part. I got the new watch. I can't tell the difference," he added. Wozniak founded Apple Computer with Steve Jobs in 1976.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Elon Musk now 3 times richer than Warren Buffett with $335 billion wealth
text: World's richest person Elon Musk's net worth rose by $24 billion to $335.1 billion on Monday as Tesla's shares surged 8.5% to all-time highs. His fortune is now more than three times that of the world's 10th richest person Warren Buffett, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. The Berkshire Hathaway Chairman has a net worth of $104.1 billion.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Petrol price increased for 7th straight day, crosses ₹110/litre-mark in Delhi
text: Petrol prices continued to rise to record highs for the seventh straight day on Tuesday. In Delhi, petrol now costs ₹110.04/litre, while the price of diesel remained unchanged at ₹98.42/litre. In Mumbai, petrol costs ₹115.85/litre and diesel ₹106.62/litre. In Chennai, petrol is priced at ₹106.66/litre and diesel at ₹102.59/litre. In Kolkata, petrol costs ₹110.49/litre and diesel ₹101.56/litre.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: What is the new Annual Information Statement launched by Income Tax Dept?
text: The Income Tax Department has launched the new Annual Information Statement (AIS) under the 'Services' tab on the new tax portal which provides a comprehensive view of information to taxpayers. It includes additional information relating to interest, dividend, securities, mutual fund transactions & foreign remittance. The reported information has been processed to remove duplicate information.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: SBI's ex-Chairman Pratip Chaudhuri arrested in loan scam case
text: Jaisalmer Police has arrested SBI's former Chairman Pratip Chaudhuri in an alleged loan scam case. The case is related to properties owned by Godawan Group, which took ₹24-crore loan from SBI for constructing a hotel. Allegations against Chaudhuri include properties worth ₹200 crore being sold for ₹25 crore after SBI seized them for defaulting on loan.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: What does the Chinese poem tweeted by Musk amid Dogecoin vs Shiba Inu rivalry mean?
text: Elon Musk tweeted an ancient Chinese poem amid Dogecoin vs Shiba Inu cryptocurrency rivalry. The poem is attributed to Cao Zhi who was asked by his suspicious king brother to prove he wasn't trying to overthrow him. The poem translates: "Beanstalks are ignited...the beans...cry out, 'We're born of the same root, why should we incinerate each other with such impatience?'"
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: KFC, Pizza Hut operator Sapphire Foods fixes IPO price band at ₹1,120-₹1,180 apiece
text: Sapphire Foods, which operates KFC, Pizza Hut and Taco Bell restaurants in India, has fixed the price band for its ₹2,073-crore IPO at ₹1,120 and ₹1,180 per share. The firm's IPO, which will open from November 9-11, is entirely an offer for sale by promoters and investors. Another KFC and Pizza Hut operator Devyani International went public earlier this year.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Coca-Cola buys full control of sports drink maker Bodyarmor for $5.6 billion
text: The Coca-Cola Company has acquired full ownership of American sports drink maker BODYARMOR by buying the remaining 85% of the company for $5.6 billion, making it the company's largest brand acquisition so far. In 2018, Coca-Cola had acquired a 15% stake in BODYARMOR. The sports drink company will be managed as a separate business within Coca-Cola's North America unit.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Mana token jumps 300% in days after Facebook changes name to Meta
text: Decentraland's Mana token surged nearly 300% over the weekend after Facebook announced that it was changing its name to Meta. The price of Mana hit an all-time high of $4.16 on Sunday and was trading around $3.4 on Monday. Mana is the native digital token of Decentraland, a self-proclaimed metaverse platform where users can buy and sell virtual properties.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Paytm to raise ₹8,250 cr from anchor investors ahead of IPO: Report
text: Paytm parent One97 Communications is set to raise ₹8,250 crore ($1.1 billion) from anchor investors as part of its ₹18,300 crore initial public offering, Moneycontrol reported. The round will reportedly see participation from BlackRock, Canada Pension Plan Investment Board, and GIC. Paytm's IPO will open for subscription on November 8 and is poised to be India's biggest ever public issue.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Policybazaar IPO subscribed 54% on day 1, retail portion fully booked
text: Policybazaar and Paisabazaar's parent company PB Fintech's nearly ₹5,700 crore initial public offering (IPO) was subscribed 0.54 times on its first day of bidding on Monday. The IPO's retail portion was fully booked as it received bids for 71.91 lakh equity shares against an offer size of 60.73 lakh equity shares. The IPO comprises a fresh issue of ₹3,750 crore.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Nykaa's ₹5,352 crore IPO subscribed nearly 82 times on final day
text: Nykaa operator FSN E-Commerce Ventures' ₹5,352-crore initial public offering (IPO) was subscribed 81.78 times on Monday, the final day of bidding. The offer received bids for 216.59 crore equity shares against an IPO size of 2.64 crore equity shares. The portion reserved for retail investors was subscribed 12.24 times, whereas that of non-institutional investors was subscribed 112.02 times.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Traders burn Bezos' effigies, demand boycott of foreign e-tailers
text: Indian traders burned effigies of Amazon's billionaire Founder Jeff Bezos as part of their "Bharat Chhodo Morcha" and demanded the boycott of foreign-owned e-commerce brands. Several associations, including the Indian Sellers Collective, carried out protests on Monday. They accused foreign e-tailers of copying the designs of their bestselling products and launching them at competitive prices.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tata Motors' net loss widens to ₹4,441 crore in September quarter
text: Tata Motors' consolidated net loss has widened to ₹4,441 crore in the July-September quarter from ₹314 crore in the same period last year. The company's consolidated revenue from operations rose 14% to ₹61,378 crore in the quarter as against ₹53,530 crore in the year-ago period. Retail sales at Jaguar Land Rover, which contributes 80% to Tata Motors' revenue, fell 18.4%.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: India's diesel sales in October rise above pre-COVID-19 level
text: India's diesel sales in October climbed back to above pre-COVID-19 level amid increased industrial activity. Diesel sales stood at 5.86 million tonnes last month, 1.3% higher than October 2019, preliminary sales data showed. Petrol, whose consumption had reached pre-pandemic level earlier this year, saw about 4% year-on-year rise in sales at 2.48 million tonnes in October.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Chaudhuri's arrest a highly motivated action: SBI's ex-Chairman
text: Former SBI Chairman Rajnish Kumar has called Pratip Chaudhuri's arrest a highly motivated and high-handed action. "This seems to be an error of judgment. There's a due process and set of rules...for sale of assets to ARCs. Where's the corruption here?" Kumar asked. Earlier, SBI's former Chairman Pratip Chaudhuri was arrested by Jaisalmer Police in an alleged loan scam case.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: ONGC asked to give 60% stake in Mumbai High, Bassein fields to foreign firms: Report
text: The Centre has asked ONGC to give away 60% stake plus operating control of Mumbai High and Bassein to foreign companies, PTI reported. Petroleum Ministry's Additional Secretary (Exploration) Amar Nath in a letter to ONGC CMD reportedly said productivity of Mumbai High and Bassein offshore assets was low. Infrastructure on the fields was ageing and needed revamping, he added.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Sensex surges 831 points, snaps 3-day losing streak; Nifty ends at 17,929
text: Indian benchmark indices snapped their three-day losing streak on Monday led by gains across financial, IT, automobile and metal shares. The Sensex rose by 831.53 points or 1.4% to close at 60,138.46, while the broader Nifty 50 added 258 points to settle at 17,929.65. IndusInd Bank, Bharti Airtel, HCL Technologies and Dr Reddy's were among the top Sensex gainers.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Don't see Nifty below 16,500, I'm bullish on PSU banks: Jhunjhunwala
text: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala said, "I don't see the Nifty going below the 16,500 mark. Market will be higher from here [until] next year." He also added that he is "extremely bullish" on public sector undertaking (PSU) banks. Talking about his investment strategy, Jhujhunwala said that he sells when prices are exorbitant and when valuations are higher than expected.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: India's trade deficit narrows to $19.9 billion in October
text: India's trade deficit in October narrowed to $19.9 billion from $22.6 billion in September, provisional data released by the government showed. The country's merchandise exports rose 42.33% to $35.47 billion in October, as against $24.92 billion in the same month last year. The merchandise imports surged 62.49% to $55.37 billion from $34.07 billion in October last year.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Zydus Cadila to reduce price of its COVID-19 vaccine to ₹265 a dose: Report
text: Gujarat-based pharma company Zydus Cadila has agreed to bring down the price of its COVID-19 vaccine to ₹265 a dose, PTI reported on Sunday. A disposable painless jet applicator costing ₹93 is required for each dose, which would take the price to ₹358 per dose. The company had earlier proposed a price of ₹1,900 for its three-dose regimen, PTI added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 'Can't great teams have an off season?': Wipro's Rishad Premji after NZ beat India
text: Wipro's Chairman Rishad Premji took to Twitter after India lost to New Zealand at the 2021 ICC Men's T20 World Cup. He tweeted, "Are we too extreme in our emotions & expectations?...We lose a couple of games and feel it's doomsday. Can't great teams have an off season?" He added, "Our long track records of success matter."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: If UN can tell how $6 bn will solve world hunger, I'll do it right now: Musk
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said if the UN's World Food Programme (WFP) can tell how $6 billion can solve world hunger, he'll sell Tesla stock right now and do it. It comes after WFP's director was quoted as saying that 2% of Musk's wealth could solve world hunger. Musk is currently the world's richest person with $311 billion in wealth.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Bill Gates celebrates his 66th birthday with Jeff Bezos, others in Turkey: Report
text: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates, who turned 66 on October 28, reportedly celebrated his birthday with Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos and others by throwing a private birthday party in a Turkish cove near Bodrum. Bezos was escorted from Gates' megayacht, Lana, to the secluded cove in a helicopter. Gates has been vacationing along Turkey's coast and visited Bodrum last week.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Hebrew speakers mock Facebook's new name 'Meta', say it means 'dead'
text: Social media users in Israel are mocking Facebook's new company name 'Meta', claiming that it sounds similar to 'dead' in the Hebrew language. Several Twitter users pointed this out in their tweets under the hashtag '#FacebookDead', with one tweeting, "Thank you for providing all Hebrew speakers a good reason to laugh." Another tweet read, "Somebody didn't do their branding research."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 5 IPOs including Paytm's to hit market in 1st half of November to raise ₹27,000 cr
text: Five firms including Paytm's parent One97 Communications and Policybazaar parent PB Fintech have their IPOs in the first half of November to jointly raise over ₹27,000 crore. The other three firms are Sapphire Foods India, which operates KFC and Pizza Hut outlets, decorative aesthetics supplier SJS Enterprises and Sigachi Industries. Paytm's ₹18,300 crore IPO, India's biggest, opens on November 8.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Informal economy shrinks to 15-20% from 52% in 3 years: SBI report
text: India's informal economy has shrunk to around 15-20% of the formal GDP as against 52% three years ago, a report by the State Bank of India's (SBI) economic research department has said. At least ₹13 lakh crore has come into the formal economy through various channels in recent years, including the scheme on the e-Shram portal, according to SBI Ecowrap.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: What is the cost of petrol and diesel in metros after hike on 6th straight day?
text: Fuel prices surged to record high levels on Monday after hike for the sixth straight day. Among the metros, prices are the highest in Mumbai where petrol costs ₹115.50/litre and diesel ₹106.62/litre. In Delhi, petrol and diesel cost ₹109.69/litre and ₹98.42/litre respectively. In Chennai, petrol is priced at ₹106.35/litre and diesel at ₹102.59/litre.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: GST collection in October crosses ₹1.3 lakh crore, second-highest ever
text: The government on Monday said that ₹1,30,127 crore gross GST revenue was collected in October 2021, the second-highest amount of GST revenue collected since GST's implementation. The revenues are 24% higher than the GST revenues in the same month last year and 36% over 2019-20. The all-time high collection figure was over ₹1.40 lakh crore in April this year.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: LPG prices for commercial cylinders increased by ₹266 from today
text: The price of commercial LPG cylinders was increased by ₹266 on Monday. Now, the price of a 19-kg commercial cylinder in Delhi will be ₹2,000.50. In Mumbai, a 19-kg commercial gas cylinder will now cost ₹1,950. In Kolkata, the commercial LPG rate stood at ₹2,073.50, while in Chennai now a 19-kg cylinder will be available for ₹2,133.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Oceanfront home with own cinema, spa sells for record $177 million in US
text: An oceanfront Malibu home that comes with its own cinema and spa has been bought by billionaire venture capitalist Marc Andreessen for $177 million (₹1,326 crore), The WSJ first reported. The property spans seven acres on two lots, while the main house is 10,000 sq feet and includes two guesthouses. It's the second most expensive property sold in the US.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: PMC Bank customers won't get ₹5 lakh insurance cover in 1st lot: Report
text: The customers of Punjab & Maharashtra Co-operative Bank (PMC Bank) will not get up to ₹5 lakh insurance cover in the first lot as the bank is under the resolution process, PTI reported. Deposit Insurance and Credit Guarantee Corporation will pay customers of 20 stressed banks except PMC Bank. The 90 day-period for the first lot concludes on November 30.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: MicroStrategy buys 9,000 Bitcoins in Q3, total holding valued at $7 bn
text: American business intelligence company MicroStrategy said it bought almost 9,000 Bitcoins in the third quarter ending September. The firm's total Bitcoin holding has increased to 1,14,042 after the purchase, which is worth around $7 billion. "We will continue to evaluate opportunities to raise additional capital to execute on our Bitcoin strategy," its CEO Michael Saylor said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Odisha announces 100% tax exemption, registration fee waiver for EVs
text: Odisha government has announced that it will give 100% exemption on motor vehicle tax and registration fees for electric vehicles. The exemption will be applicable till December 31, 2025. Under the Odisha Electric Vehicle Policy 2021, the state will provide 15% subsidy, a maximum of ₹5,000 for two-wheelers, ₹10,000 for three-wheelers, and ₹50,000 for four-wheelers on the base price.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Tesla board member sold $200 mn of stock as shares hit record high
text: Tesla board member Ira Ehrenpreis sold shares of the electric car maker worth more than $200 million after the share price crossed $1,000 mark for the first time to hit an all-time high. Ehrenpreis exercised options to buy 370,000 shares at about $50 each on Wednesday. He then sold 203,429 shares for as high as $1,068.38 apiece, regulatory filings revealed.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Nazara Technologies' net profit rises 9.8% y-o-y to ₹14.5 cr in Q2
text: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Nazara Technologies' consolidated net profit increased by 9.8% year-on-year to ₹14.5 crore for the September 2021 quarter. The gaming company's revenue jumped 17.8% to ₹129.6 crore, compared with ₹110 crore in the year-ago period. "Nazara declared revenue of ₹260.8 crore and EBITDA of ₹49.6 crore in H1 FY22," company's Group CEO Manish Agarwal said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: High taxes hampering growth of luxury car segment: Audi India Head
text: Audi India Head Balbir Singh Dhillon said that high taxation is restricting the growth of luxury car segment in India. "The luxury segment has remained less than 2% of overall passenger vehicle vertical...The major request we have for the government is to reduce the duties," he told PTI. "We are one of the countries where taxation is highest," he added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Inflation is pricking people, Centre will control it in time: Pradhan
text: Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said, "Inflation is pricking people. Everybody is concerned including the government. The Centre will control this inflation in time." India imports 80% of petroleum products, which has led to an increase in the prices, he added. "I believe that the Petroleum Ministry will speak to countries producing them at OPEC. The situation should improve," Pradhan said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Rise in services on domestic routes bringing down airfares: Scindia
text: Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia has said that the expansion of air services on domestic routes was bringing down fares. "Airfare between some cities is cheaper than second-class air-conditioned train tickets," he added. "PM Narendra Modi wants people wearing slippers to fly. That's why the government is working to set up airports in small cities as well," Scindia said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Excise collection on petrol products 79% more than pre-COVID-19 level: Data
text: Government's excise duty collection from petroleum products is 79% more than pre-COVID-19 level, data from the Controller General of Accounts (CGA) showed. The excise duty collection has surged by 33% to over ₹1.71 lakh crore in the first six months of financial year 2021-22, from ₹1.28 lakh crore in the year-ago period. Excise collection for 2019-20 was ₹3.89 lakh crore.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Cooperative sector can turn India into $5 trillion economy: Amit Shah
text: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that the cooperative sector has a potential to turn India into a $5 trillion economy. Speaking at an event organised to mark the completion of 75 years of Amul, he added, "The sector should also take up the task of developing new vegetable varieties." Shah said, "This will ensure...profits reach...farmers, not the private companies."
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: China's factory activity contracts for second straight month
text: China's factory activity contracted for the second consecutive month in October. The official manufacturing Purchasing Manager's Index (PMI) fell to 49.2 in October from 49.6 in September, data from National Bureau of Statistics showed. "About one-third of the surveyed companies listed insufficient demand as...biggest difficulty," said Zhang Liqun, an analyst at China Logistics Information Center.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: IRCTC's profit rises 386% y-o-y to ₹158.57 crore in September quarter
text: Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) on Monday reported a 386% year-on-year rise in net profit to ₹158.57 crore for the July-September quarter. The company's revenue from operations increased by 357.3% to ₹404.9 crore in the quarter. IRCTC's sales from internet ticketing surged 355% to ₹265.3 crore, while catering saw its sales rise 315% to ₹71.39 crore in Q2.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Indian Bank reports fraud worth ₹266 crore to RBI
text: Indian Bank has reported fraud worth ₹266.73 crore to the RBI, relating to three non-performing accounts (NPAs). It said it has declared MP Border Checkpost Development as fraud with an outstanding of ₹166.89 crore, Pune Sholapur Road Development with ₹72.76 crore and SONAC with ₹27.08 crore. The nature of fraud for the accounts has been specified as "diversion of funds."
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Jes Staley steps down as Barclays CEO amid Epstein probe
text: Barclays CEO Jes Staley has stepped down following a probe by the UK regulators into his ties with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. Barclays said that the preliminary conclusion "makes no findings that Staley saw, or was aware of, any of Epstein's alleged crimes". Barclays' Head of Global Markets CS Venkatakrishnan will replace Staley as the CEO.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Saudi Aramco's Q3 net profit surges 158% y-o-y to $30.4 billion
text: World's biggest energy company Saudi Aramco's net profit rose by 158% to $30.4 billion in the third quarter as against $11.8 billion in the same period last year. The company's free cash flow rose to $28.7 billion and it declared a dividend of $18.8 billion for the third quarter. Aramco has a market valuation of over $2 trillion.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: India's manufacturing PMI rises to 8-month high of 55.9 in October
text: India's manufacturing sector activity grew at its strongest pace since February as companies scaled up production and stepped up input purchasing, according to a private survey. The IHS Markit India Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) rose to 55.9 in October from 53.7 in September.  However, jobs failed to increase despite the overall improvement in operating conditions, it added.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Elon Musk with $300 billion net worth becomes wealthier than entire GDP of Pakistan
text: World's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk has become wealthier than entire GDP of Pakistan, which is around $280 billion. Musk on Saturday became the first person to cross a net worth of $300 billion as Tesla's shares surged this week. Earlier this week, Tesla surpassed the market capitalisation of $1 trillion.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Microsoft overtakes Apple as world's most valuable company
text: Microsoft Corp on Friday overtook Apple Inc to become the world's most valuable public company after iPhone maker's shares continued to fall after missing earnings expectations on Thursday. Apple's shares were down 3.6% at $147, implying a market capitalisation of $2.41 trillion while Microsoft's shares were up 0.7% at $326.8 at a market valuation of $2.46 trillion.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Mumbai Police shares meme on Facebook name change, says, 'MET-A citizen with no mask'
text: After Facebook changed its company name to 'Meta', Mumbai Police on Saturday shared a meme that read, "Met-A citizen without their mask on? Tell them they are not safe." "And that they may need to 'Face' the 'Book' of Law for violation #AccountOfSafety," the police department tweeted along with the meme.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: 'Squid Game' crypto surges 1,00,000% in days, price-tracking site issues warning
text: A cryptocurrency called 'Squid Game', inspired from the South Korean series, has surged from $0.012 on Tuesday to $12 on Saturday, representing a 1,00,000% jump. Price-tracking website CoinMarketCap issued a warning, saying it received "multiple reports" that users aren't able to sell this token on PancakeSwap. This project is "unlikely to be affiliated" with the show's official IP, it added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Elon Musk becomes world's 1st person to cross $300 billion net worth
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has become the world's first person to cross a net worth of $300 billion as Tesla's shares surged this week. His fortune hit the mark as of Thursday and is currently at $311 billion, according to Bloomberg Billionaires Index. World's second richest person Jeff Bezos' net worth is over $100 billion less than that of Musk's.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: If you die in metaverse, you die in real life: Musk posts meme on Facebook rebranding
text: After Facebook changed the company's name to Meta, Tesla CEO Elon Musk shared a meme featuring Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg with the words 'If you die in the metaverse, you die in real life'. "Is this...new story arc for Black Mirror?" a Twitter user asked. Earlier, Twitter users shared Musk's old Twitter bio reading, "meta for k", following Facebook's rebranding.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: People share Elon Musk's old 'meta for k' Twitter bio after Facebook changes name
text: After Facebook changed the company's name to 'Meta', Twitter users shared Tesla CEO Elon Musk's old Twitter bio reading, "meta for k". A Twitter user shared a picture of the bio and wrote, "Elon, someone is stealing from you!!!" Musk responded to the user's tweet on Friday with a laughing emoji.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Reliance Jio declines AGR dues moratorium, becomes only telco to do so: Report
text: Reliance Jio has reportedly said it won't opt for the government's four-year moratorium on spectrum and adjusted gross revenue (AGR) payments, becoming the only telecom company to do so. Earlier, both Bharti Airtel and Vodafone Idea (Vi ) accepted both forms of moratorium under the relief package. On Thursday, Reliance Jio paid ₹10,792 crore spectrum dues to the government.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: EV maker Ather Energy launches 'OATs for champions' after Bajaj Auto MD's remark
text: A day after Bajaj Auto MD Rajiv Bajaj took a dig at electric vehicle start-ups, EV maker Ather Energy tweeted, "Launching our new line of products for a quicker and smarter start to the day- OATs for champions Recommended by experts." Bajaj had said that legacy companies like Bajaj Auto eat OATS (Ola, Ather, Tork Motors and SmartE) for breakfast.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Paytm to rank among India's 50 most-valued listed firms with its ₹18,300-crore IPO
text: Paytm will rank among India's 50 most-valued listed companies following its ₹18,300-crore IPO next month. At the upper end of the ₹2,080-₹2,150 apiece price range, Paytm will have a post-money valuation of ₹1,39,378.84 crore, giving it the 36th position among listed firms by market value, reports said. Its valuation will outrank companies like Hindustan Zinc and Mahindra & Mahindra.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Adani to buy stake in Flipkart-owned Cleartrip, include it in 'super app'
text: Billionaire Gautam Adani-led Adani Group has said that it has agreed to buy a "significant minority stake" in the Flipkart-owned online travel aggregator Cleartrip. "The Cleartrip platform will become an essential part of the broader super app journey we've embarked upon," Chairman Adani said. In April, Flipkart and Adani Group had inked a deal to build data and fulfilment centres.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: We really trust Indian industry: WHO amid delay in Covaxin approval
text: Responding to a question on delay in EUL approval to India's Covaxin COVID-19 vaccine, a WHO official has said that the health body 'really trusts' the Indian industry. Asserting that India produces "high-quality vaccines", WHO's Dr Mariangela Simao said, "We're...at the last stage of the assessment...and we hope to have a final recommendation to the WHO next week."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Fuel prices increased for 5th straight day, petrol crosses ₹115/litre-mark in Mumbai
text: The fuel prices have been increased for the fifth straight day on Sunday. Petrol and diesel prices were hiked by 35 paise per litre each in Delhi after which petrol is retailing at ₹109.34 per litre while diesel costs ₹98.07 per litre. Among the metro cities, fuel is costliest in Mumbai where petrol costs ₹115.15, while diesel costs ₹106.23.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: India's fiscal deficit for April-September at ₹5.26 lakh crore
text: India's April to September period fiscal deficit is at ₹5.26 lakh crore or 35% of the budget estimates, as per data released by Controller General of Accounts. The deficit figure in the same period last year had soared to 114.8% of the budget estimates. The central government's total receipts stood at ₹10.99 lakh crore or 55.6% of estimates.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Petrol price hiked for 4th day in a row, nears ₹115 a litre in Mumbai
text: Petrol and diesel prices were hiked for the fourth consecutive day on Saturday, hitting new record highs. The latest hike of 35 paise each took petrol price to ₹108.99 per litre in Delhi and diesel price to ₹97.72. In Mumbai, petrol price rose to ₹114.81 per litre, while diesel reached ₹105.86. In Kolkata, petrol now costs ₹109.46 per litre.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Sensex ends 678 points lower at 59,307, a day after 1,159-point crash
text: The Sensex ended nearly 678 points lower at 59,307 on Friday, a day after the benchmark indices witnessed their worst fall in six months. Meanwhile, the broader Nifty 50 fell over 185 points to close at 17,671.65. Tech Mahindra, NTPC and IndusInd Bank were among top Sensex laggards. The Sensex had crashed 1,159 points on Thursday.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Avantha Group's Gautam Thapar denied bail in money laundering case
text: A Delhi court has dismissed bail plea filed by Avantha Group's Founder Gautam Thapar, arrested by ED in connection with an alleged money laundering case. The judge observed that since huge loss of public money was involved, the case needed to be viewed seriously. Thapar was arrested in August after carrying out raids at multiple locations in Delhi and Mumbai.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: China will suffer a loss of ₹50,000 crore on exports this Diwali: CAIT
text: Speaking about the Diwali festive period, the Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) said that it has given a call of 'boycott Chinese goods' this year. "It is certain that China is going to suffer a business loss of about ₹50,000 crore in terms of stoppage of import of Chinese goods by Indian traders," CAIT stated.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Vedanta warned by SEBI over ₹1,407-crore related party transaction
text: SEBI has warned Vedanta for executing related party transaction worth ₹1,407-crore without prior approval of the audit committee. "It was done at an arm's length distance and in the ordinary course of business," Vedanta said. On being asked about a delay in disclosing the outcome of board meeting dated October 3, 2020, Vedanta said it was "due to unforeseen circumstances".
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tesla shares record biggest monthly gain in Oct in almost a year
text: Tesla shares recorded their biggest monthly gain in October since November last year with an all-time high market valuation of $1.1 trillion. Shares of the world's richest person Elon Musk-led company surged 44% in October. The development comes after Tesla reported record deliveries in third quarter, followed by strong earnings and an order of 100,000 cars from rental company Hertz.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Meta Platforms shares rise after Facebook rebrands to 'Meta'
text: Meta Platforms' shares rose 1% to $319.95 in premarket trading on Friday after Facebook rebranded itself to 'Meta'. The firm had gained as much as 4.3% on Thursday. Besides Meta Platforms, a Canadian firm Meta Materials jumped 4.6% to $4.77 in pre-market trading on Friday and is now worth about $1.33 billion, as of current share price.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Nykaa IPO subscribed 4.8 times on Day 2
text: The IPO of Nykaa-parent FSN E-Commerce Ventures was subscribed 4.8 times on the second day of issue. Investors made bids for over 12.7 crore equity shares against the total issue size of over two crore equity shares, NSE data revealed. The IPO was subscribed 1.55 times on the first day. Nykaa aims to raise over ₹5,350 crore through the IPO.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: HC rejects Future Group's plea for stay on arbitration order on RIL deal
text: The Delhi High Court has rejected Future Group's plea for a stay on an order by a Singapore arbitration panel refusing to interfere with the Emergency Award (EA) which stopped it from moving forward with ₹24,713 crore Reliance deal. The court further sought a response from Amazon. Appeals by Future Coupons and Future Retail will now be heard in January.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Fuel prices continue to rise in Hyd; petrol nears ₹114/L in city
text: Fuel prices continued to rise in Hyderabad as petrol and diesel prices were hiked again on Saturday. The latest hike of 35 paise each took petrol price to ₹113.36 per litre in Hyderabad and diesel price to ₹106.60/litre. Notably, in October alone, fuel prices have been hiked more than 10 times. On October 1, petrol's price was ₹106/litre in Hyderabad.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: 1,400 American Airlines flights cancelled in 3 days till Sunday
text: American Airlines has cancelled more than 1,400 flights in the three days till Sunday due to staff shortages and unfavourable weather, according to the airline's statement. The statement said that 551 flights on Saturday, 480 flights on Sunday along with 376 flights on Friday were cancelled. A flight-tracking site FlightAware said that over 1,000 flights were also delayed since Friday.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Indians' belief in country's economic future has diminished: Rajan
text: Former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan has said that Indians' belief in the country's economic future has diminished in the recent years. "We have gotten a little less confident...the pandemic toll has further diminished our self-belief...even further while pushing many in the middle-class into poverty," he added. "Growth that does not take everybody along, is unsustainable," Rajan further said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Indian Oil's net profit rises marginally to ₹6,360.05 crore in Q2
text: India's largest refiner Indian Oil Corporation has posted a net profit of ₹6,360.05 crore in the September quarter on a standalone basis, compared with ₹6,227.31 crore in the year-ago period. The company's revenue from operations rose about 46% to ₹1.69 lakh crore. An interim dividend of ₹5 per equity share has also been declared by the company's board, it said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Facebook changes its company name to 'Meta'
text: Facebook on Thursday announced it's changing the company's name to 'Meta' to reflect its focus on 'metaverse'. Using augmented reality and virtual reality, Facebook plans to create a greater sense of "virtual presence" to mimic the experience of interacting in person. "The names of the apps that we build—Facebook, Instagram, Messenger and WhatsApp—will remain the same," the company said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Delhi HC notice to RBI, SBI over banning UPI payments in crypto exchanges
text: The Delhi High Court on Thursday issued notice to RBI, SBI, NPCI and others on a petition seeking the rollback of the decision of prohibiting UPI payments in the crypto exchanges. The plea alleged that SBI's decision of blocking UPI services for WazirX users violated a Supreme Court judgement. The matter is now slated for hearing on December 24.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Shares of Canadian firm 'META' jump over 30% after Facebook changes name
text: The shares of a Canadian material science company Meta Materials (META) surged after Mark Zuckerberg announced that Facebook is changing its company name to 'Meta'. The stock surged as much as 26% in after-hour trading, following a 4.8% gain during market hours, Bloomberg reported. Meta Materials' CEO George Palikaras tweeted, "I would like to cordially welcome Facebook to the #metaverse."
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Ether hits fresh record high above $4,400, surpasses May peak
text: Ether, the world's second-largest cryptocurrency by market value, soared to a record above $4,400 on Friday. It gained as much as 3.5% to $4,403.93, surpassing the previous record of $4,379.62 it hit in May. It was up more than 46% this month after hitting the mark, CoinDesk data revealed. Ether's market value surged to around $520 billion.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: 'Man who takes 6 months parental leave is a loser,' says Palantir Co-founder
text: Several Twitter users criticised US-based Palantir Technologies' Co-founder Joe Lonsdale after he said, "Any man in an important position who takes six months of leave for a newborn is a loser." Lonsdale was responding to a tweet about US Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg, who took leave for his child. "Respect that people have different choices," Initialized Capital's Garry Tan wrote.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Legacy companies eat Ola, Ather, Tork & SmartE (OATS) for breakfast: Rajiv Bajaj
text: Bajaj Auto's MD Rajiv Bajaj on Thursday took a jibe at startups that have entered the electric scooter segment and said that legacy companies like theirs eat OATS (Ola, Ather, Tork Motors and SmartE) for breakfast. "I'm going to bet on BET — Bajaj, (Royal) Enfield and TVS," he said. "They have a proven track record," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Indian market has 3 key beauties: Paytm CEO ahead of ₹18,300-crore IPO
text: Vijay Shekhar Sharma, the CEO of Paytm that plans to raise ₹18,300 crore in India's biggest IPO, told Moneycontrol, "Indian market has three key beauties." Sharma said, "It has a large number of underserved customers...Second, there's a large customer base who are smartphone (users)." He added, "The third is a market where there's a new product to serve to customers."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Who are the top 10 new entrants on Hurun India's philanthropy list?
text: Ace investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala is the top new entrant on EdelGive Hurun India Philanthropy List 2021 by donating ₹50 crore. He's followed by Intas Pharmaceuticals' Hasmukh Chudgar & family and FMCG industry's Rajiv Kumar & Ravinder Kumar. Actor Akshay Kumar debuted on the list by donating ₹26 crore, followed by Zerodha's Nithin & Nikhil Kamath and Sun Pharma's Dilip Shanghvi.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Paytm will not force employees to come to office: CEO
text: Paytm will continue to allow employees to work from home and will not force them to come to the office, CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma said on Thursday. He added, "We will be 100% flexible forever for good." In September, Sharma had tweeted, "Future of work (for technology/ knowledge companies) will be a choice between hybrid and work from home."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Govt asks IRCTC to share 50% of service charge from e-ticketing
text: The Railways Ministry has asked the IRCTC to share 50% of its proceeds of service charge on e-ticketing. The IRCTC will start sharing half of the convenience fees with the government from November 1, 2021. Analysts believe the development may impact IRCTC's revenues in the future as a large chunk of IRCTC's revenues come from internet ticketing services.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Labour Ministry hikes minimum wages for central sphere workers from October 1
text: Union Minister Bhupender Yadav announced that the Ministry of Labour and Employment has revised the rate of variable dearness allowance or minimum wages for scheduled employment in the central sphere. The hike, that's effective from October 1, will benefit about 1.5 crore workers, he said. Central sphere workers are those employed for construction, road maintenance, sweeping, cleaning and others.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Govt withdraws decision to seek 50% share of IRCTC convenience fee
text: DIPAM Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey announced on Twitter that the Ministry of Railways has decided to withdraw the decision on IRCTC convenience fee. On Thursday, the IRCTC said the government had asked it to share 50% of its proceeds of service charge on e-ticketing from November 1, 2021. IRCTC's shares had tanked over 25% in early trades on Friday.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Petrol, diesel prices hiked for the 3rd day in a row
text: Petrol and diesel prices were hiked for the third straight day on Friday, touching fresh all-time highs across India. A 35 paise hike took petrol price in Delhi to ₹108.64 per litre and diesel price to ₹97.37. In Mumbai, petrol now costs ₹114.47 per litre, while diesel price rose to ₹105.49. In Kolkata, petrol is retailing at ₹109.12 per litre.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Shaktikanta Das reappointed as RBI Governor for three years
text: The government on Friday extended Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor Shaktikanta Das' tenure by three more years. The reappointment is effective for three years beyond December 10, 2021, or until further orders, whichever is earlier, an official statement said. Das was appointed as the 25th Governor of the RBI in December 2018 after Urjit Patel resigned from the post.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: 'Market research analyst' recognised as specialty job for H-1B visa in US
text: A federal court has approved a settlement under which the US Citizenship and Immigration Services agreed to qualify 'market research analyst' as a speciality occupation for considering H-1B visas for foreign professionals. "This settlement is an important victory that will benefit hundreds of American businesses and the market research analysts they sought to employ," an attorney said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Aditya Ghosh pens note to father upon completing Management Program from Harvard
text: Former IndiGo chief Aditya Ghosh on Thursday revealed that he received a degree in Advanced Management Program from the Harvard Business School seven months ago. Paying homage to his late father on his birthday, Ghosh wrote, "He would've been so proud and happy...I'd never been to business school...I'm so happy that my father could see me enrol into the program."
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: IRCTC shares tank 25% after govt asks it to share 50% of convenience fee
text: The shares of Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) plunged more than 25% during early trade on Friday. This comes after the Railways Ministry asked IRCTC to share 50% of its proceeds of service charge on e-ticketing from November 1. IRCTC earned ₹299.13 crore from the convenience fee during 2020-21, according to its annual report.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Investors lose ₹4.82 lakh crore in a day as Sensex sees the worst fall in 6 months
text: The investors' wealth dropped by ₹4.82 lakh crore on Thursday with the BSE Sensex diving 1,159 points to close at 59,985 in its worst fall in over six months. The combined m-cap of BSE-listed companies declined by ₹4,82,324.47 crore to stand at ₹2,60,48,949.80 crore. ITC was the biggest laggard, falling 5.54%, followed by ICICI Bank, Kotak Bank and Axis Bank.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 10 CEOs trolled me: Palantir Co-founder who criticised paternity leave
text: Palantir Technologies' Co-founder Joe Lonsdale has said over 10 CEOs have trolled him by saying they will be taking six months off to spend with their families. Earlier, Lonsdale had said any man in an important position taking six months of leave for a newborn is a "loser". Lonsdale questioned the common sense of men who take such a leave.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Have made $6 bn from Tesla from $380-mn investment: US billionaire
text: US billionaire Ron Baron has said that his fund has made $6 billion from Tesla from a $380-million investment made seven or eight years ago. "I think we'll probably be an investor for another 10 years, same with SpaceX," Baron told CNBC. "When I first met Elon 10 years ago...I was...skeptical about whether it [Tesla] would be successful," he added.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Nykaa IPO subscribed 1.55 times on Day-1
text: The initial public offering (IPO) of Nykaa's operator, FSN E-Commerce Ventures, was subscribed 1.55 times on the first day of the issue. It received bids for over 4.09 crore equity shares against an IPO size of 2.64 crore, data showed. The portion reserved for retail investors was subscribed 3.5 times, while that of qualified institutional buyers was subscribed 1.39 times.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Bombay HC quashes cheating proceedings against Amazon India head
text: The Bombay High Court quashed the cheating proceedings issued against Amazon's India head Amit Agarwal by a Magistrate Court in Ulhasnagar. A customer had filed a complaint after he placed an order for a hard drive on Amazon's website for ₹3,999 but didn't receive it. Agarwal wasn't personally dealing with the transaction and can't be accused of cheating, HC said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Centre releases ₹44,000 cr to states, UTs as GST compensation shortfall
text: The Ministry of Finance has released ₹44,000 crore to states and Union Territories with legislature to compensate them for the shortfall in GST revenue. With this, the total amount released in 2021-22 as GST compensation reached ₹1.59 lakh crore, the ministry said. "It's expected...this release will help...states and UTs in planning...public expenditure among other things," it added.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Looks like we're finally emerging out of COVID-19 crisis: IndiGo CEO
text: IndiGo CEO Ronojoy Dutta has said that India seems to be finally emerging out of the COVID-19 pandemic. He added that it is now time for the country's aviation industry to repair and heal from the damage caused by the pandemic. IndiGo operator InterGlobe Aviation reported a net loss of ₹1,435.7 crore for July to September quarter.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Morgan Stanley downgrades Indian equities due to expensive valuations
text: Morgan Stanley on Thursday downgraded Indian equities to equal-weight from overweight due to expensive valuations. The brokerage said that Indian equities could see some consolidation ahead of the Fed tapering, a likely rate hike by the RBI in February and higher energy costs. "We see valuations as increasingly constraining returns over the next 3-6 months," Morgan Stanley said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: India's gold demand rises 47% to 139 tonnes in September quarter: WGC
text: India's gold demand increased by 47% year-on-year to 139.1 tonnes in the July-September quarter, the World Gold Council (WGC) said in a report. Gold demand in the country is bouncing back to pre-COVID-19 levels and the outlook looks bullish going forward, it added. In terms of value, India's gold demand went up by 37% to ₹59,330 crore in the quarter.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: RBI should let rupee gain to contain imported inflation: SBI Research
text: The RBI should let the rupee rally against the dollar to contain imported inflation coming in mainly from crude prices and help push exports, SBI Research said in a report. Current account risks from rising oil prices can be contained at 1.4% of GDP, it added. Indian rupee gained 11 paise to close at 74.92 against US dollar on Thursday.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Navi Mutual Fund offers SIPs starting at ₹500
