text: Navi Mutual Fund is offering investors the option to start Systematic Investment Plans (SIPs) with ₹500 on its app. “With the recent spike in demand for mutual funds, Navi promises to offer a hassle-free digital experience to users and it is emerging as a preferred platform for direct investments”, the company said. Users can start investing via the Navi app.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Cognizant had to choose clients to serve: CEO as attrition rate hits 33%
text: Cognizant CEO Brian Humphries has said the firm does not have enough headcount to "fulfill our potential" and that it had to choose the clients to serve and deals to chase. Cognizant in its September quarter saw 33% attrition rate. In comparison, attrition for Infosys, Wipro and Tech Mahindra stood close to 20%, while TCS reported 11.9%.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos are now worth nearly half a trillion dollars
text: The combined net worth of the world's two richest persons Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos neared $500 billion on Wednesday amid a rally in tech stocks. Tesla and SpaceX CEO's net worth rose to $292 billion, while Amazon and Blue Origin Founder Bezos' fortune rose to $196 billion. Their fortunes are more than Johnson & Johnson's market value, Bloomberg reported.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Clear Air India dues, purchase tickets in cash: Govt to ministries
text: The Department of Expenditure, which comes under the Finance Ministry, on Wednesday asked all ministries and departments to clear dues of Air India and purchase tickets by making cash payments. Since the disinvestment process of Air India has started, the airline has stopped extending credit limit, it said. Earlier, the government sold Air India to Tata Sons for ₹18,000 crore.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Retail portion of Nykaa's ₹5,352-crore IPO fully booked in an hour of opening
text: Retail portion of Nykaa's ₹5,352-crore IPO was subscribed 100% within an hour of opening on Thursday, according to BSE data. However, its overall subscription stood at 0.24 times after an hour. The price band for the IPO, which will remain open till November 1, was fixed at ₹1,085-1,125 per share. The company is seeking a valuation of about ₹53,204 crore.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Paytm fixes price band at ₹2,080-₹2,150 per share for ₹18,300-crore IPO
text: Paytm parent One97 Communications has fixed the price band for its ₹18,300-crore IPO at ₹2,080-₹2,150 per share. The IPO, which will open for subscription from November 8-10, will be India's biggest ever public issue, a record that was previously held by Coal India. The company is reportedly seeking a valuation of $20 billion (around ₹1.5 lakh crore) through the IPO.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: CBI arrests 6 people in ₹6,000 crore remittance scam at Bank of Baroda
text: The CBI has arrested six persons in connection with the ₹6,000-crore foreign exchange remittance scam in the Bank of Baroda which was detected in 2015. Searches at 14 locations were also carried out. Remittances to South-East Asian countries by 59 current account holders from Delhi's Ashok Vihar branch were allegedly made in the garb of purported payments of "non-existent" imports.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Petrol, diesel prices increased again, Mumbai's petrol cost highest across metros
text: The price of petrol and diesel was increased again on Thursday. Petrol in the national capital Delhi today costs ₹108.29 per litre, while diesel in the capital city was retailing at ₹97.02 per litre. Mumbai's petrol cost is the highest across metro cities at ₹114.14 per litre while diesel in the country's financial capital costs ₹105.12 per litre.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Sensex crashes 1,159 points to end below 60,000 in worst fall in 6 months
text: The Sensex ended 1,159 points lower at 59,985 on Thursday as the Indian markets recorded their biggest single-day fall since April. Meanwhile, the Nifty 50 index slumped around 354 points to close at 17,857. The indices ended with heavy losses following Morgan Stanley's downgrade of Indian equities to 'equal-weight' from 'overweight' due to expensive valuations.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Who are India's top philanthropists according to Hurun's latest list?
text: Wipro's Founder Chairman Azim Premji and family have topped the EdelGive Hurun India Philanthropy List 2021 by donating ₹9,713 crore from April 1, 2020, to March 31, 2021, at an average of ₹27 crore per day. They're followed by HCL Tech's Shiv Nadar and family, Mukesh Ambani and family and Kumar Mangalam Birla and family. Infosys' Nandan Nilekani ranks fifth.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Isha Ambani joins Smithsonian's National Museum of Asian Art's board
text: Reliance Jio Director Isha Ambani has joined the Smithsonian's National Museum of Asian Art's board of trustees for a four-year term effective September 23, 2021. "Ambani has a deep love for Indian art and a passion to bring that art to new audiences," the museum in Washington, DC, said. US VP Kamala Harris is also on the museum's 17-member board.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Reliance-Iconix joint venture acquires rights for Lee Cooper in India
text: A joint venture (JV) between Reliance Industries and US-based Iconix Brand Group has acquired the brand rights for Lee Cooper in India. Iconix, which owns international rights to the brand, previously licensed Future Group to sell Lee Cooper products in India, but that deal ended earlier this year. Reliance-Iconix JV already owns 24 brands from Iconix portfolio, including Ed Hardy.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Sensex tanks over 1,050 points, Nifty trades below 17,900
text: The Indian benchmark indices fell over 1.7% each on Thursday with the Sensex plunging more than 1,050 points. Sensex was trading below 60,100 levels while the broader Nifty 50 slumped around 330 points to trade below the 17,900-mark. ITC was the top loser on the Sensex, followed by Titan, ICICI Bank and several other bank stocks.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Taxing billionaires won't ease US national debt: World's richest person Elon Musk
text: Elon Musk, the world's richest person with $292 billion fortune, said taxing all "billionaires at 100%" would only make a "small dent" toward paying off the US national debt. "According to their (lawmakers') own estimates, this tax only covers 10% of the $3.5 trillion spending bill," he wrote on Twitter. "Spending is the real problem," the Tesla CEO added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: SoftBank to sell stake worth ₹1,875 cr in IPO-bound PolicyBazaar
text: Japanese conglomerate SoftBank will be selling 20% of its stake in IPO-bound PolicyBazaar worth ₹1,875 crore. The Masayoshi Son-led investment firm reportedly owns about 13% stake in PolicyBazaar. The online insurance aggregator has fixed the price band for its IPO at ₹940-980 per share and the IPO will open on November 1.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Maruti Suzuki to launch EVs only after 2025: Chairman RC Bhargava
text: Maruti Suzuki India Chairman RC Bhargava said the company will launch electric vehicles (EVs) in the country only after 2025 as demand for such vehicles is less at the moment. Maruti would like to sell around 10,000 units a month whenever it enters the electric mobility space, he added. Bhargava said it's difficult to predict pricing of EVs at present.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Govt appoints KV Kamath as Chairperson of newly set up ₹20,000-cr DFI
text: The Centre has appointed veteran banker KV Kamath, as the Chairperson of the National Bank for Financing Infrastructure and Development (NaBFID), a newly set up ₹20,000-crore development finance institution (DFI). In March, the Parliament had passed a bill to set up NaBFID to fund infrastructure projects. Kamath has previously served as Infosys' Chairman and ICICI Bank's Chairman from 2009-2015.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: ITC's Q2 profit rises 13.67% to ₹3,697 cr, revenue at ₹13,553 crore
text: ITC posted a 13.67% year-on-year increase in standalone net profit at ₹3,697.18 crore in the July-September quarter, as against ₹3,252.62 crore in the year-ago period. The company's standalone revenue from operations rose 11.97% to ₹13,553.52 crore in comparison to ₹12,103.75 crore in the same quarter last year. The company's shares have generated returns of 40% in the last one year.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Adani Ports scraps plans to build container terminal in Myanmar
text: Adani Ports on Wednesday said it was abandoning plans to build a container terminal in Myanmar. The decision was taken after a review of the situation, including exploring any divestment opportunities, it added. In May, the firm had said that it would abandon the project and write down the investment if found to be in violation of US sanctions.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Unitech appoints Ashok Kumar Yadav as CEO
text: Unitech on Wednesday appointed its COO Ashok Kumar Yadav as CEO of the company. Yadav's tenure has been extended for a period of two years after the conclusion of his present term on February 11, 2022. It also extended the tenure of Kailash Chand Sharma as Company Secretary and Compliance Officer of the Unitech Group of Companies for one year.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Axis Bank's shares fall over 6% after September quarter results
text: Shares of Axis Bank fell by 6.52% to close at ₹787.35 on the BSE on Wednesday after the bank posted its September quarter results. Axis Bank reported a 86.2% year-on-year increase in standalone profit at ₹3,133.32 crore for the quarter, as against ₹1,682.67 crore in the year-ago period. Its net interest income grew by 7.8% to ₹7,900 crore.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Forex reserves surge by $58.38 billion in March-Sept period: RBI report
text: The country's foreign exchange reserves surged by $58.38 billion to $635.36 billion in April to September period this year, according to an RBI report released on Wednesday. The forex reserves were at $576.98 billion at the end of March. Out of the total Foreign Currency Assets (FCA) of $573.60 billion, $383.74 billion was invested in securities, the report said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: SC allows Centre's appeal against giving Airtel ₹923 cr as GST refund
text: The Supreme Court has allowed the Centre's appeal against the Delhi High Court's order, which permitted Bharti Airtel to claim a GST refund of ₹923 crore. The High Court had allowed Bharti Airtel to rectify its GST returns from July to September 2017 and claim the refund. The High Court had also directed Centre to verify the excess GST claim.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Indians paid ₹26,300 crore in foreign exchange fees in 2020: Study
text: Indians paid more than ₹26,300 crore as foreign exchange fees in 2020, a study released by Wise revealed. Of the total, nearly ₹9,700 crore was hidden as exchange rate markups on currency conversions, payments and card purchases. Between 2016 and 2020, annual amount Indians lost in fees and exchange rate markups increased from ₹18,700 crore to ₹26,300 crore, it said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: India's crude oil imports rise 16% in September, hit 5-month high
text: India's crude oil imports in September increased by 16% from a year earlier to reach their highest level since April. According to data by Petroleum Planning and Analysis Cell, crude oil imports rose to 17.61 million tonnes in September. Reliance Industries, the operator of the world's biggest refining complex, imported nearly 12% more oil in September than in August.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Adani Ports shares tank 7% after Q2 profit falls 30% to ₹968.3 cr
text: Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone shares tumbled by 7.67% to close at ₹688.45 after it reported a 30.58% fall in consolidated net profit at ₹968.3 crore for the July-September quarter. It had posted a consolidated net profit of ₹1,393.7 crore in the year-ago period. The company also said it was abandoning plans to build a container terminal in Myanmar.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Future Retail moves Delhi HC seeking stay on SIAC order on Reliance deal
text: Kishore Biyani-led Future Retail has moved the Delhi High Court seeking relief against the Singapore International Arbitration Centre's (SIAC) order on its deal with Reliance Retail. SIAC had rejected Future Retail's plea to lift the stay on its ₹24,713 crore deal with Reliance. SIAC had also said Future Retail is a party to the matter between Amazon and Future Group.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Refer friends & get a chance to win Bitcoin worth ₹5L: CoinSwitch Kuber
text: CoinSwitch Kuber has launched 'CSK Referral League' coinciding with the ongoing T20 World Cup. Users can participate by visiting the app and inviting friends to join CoinSwitch Kuber. The crypto trading app promises to reward top 100 daily winners from the referral leaderboard with bitcoin worth up to ₹2 lakh and one lucky winner will win bitcoin worth ₹5 lakh.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Making quality medicines super affordable with flat 25% off: Apollo 24|7
text: Apollo 24|7 is offering flat 25% discount on first three medicine orders aiming to ensure Indians choose quality above all when it comes to healthcare. Circle members can save up to 30% on healthcare essentials from Apollo Pharmacy, it announced. Users can avail this Diwali gift on Apollo 24|7 app and website with 2-hour doorstep delivery across major metropolitan cities.*
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: No approval for Covaxin yet as WHO seeks further clarifications from Bharat Biotech
text: The WHO's technical advisory group has asked for additional clarifications from Bharat Biotech for its COVID-19 vaccine Covaxin to conduct a final emergency use listing (EUL) "risk-benefit assessment". "It will reconvene for the final assessment on...November 3, if data [is] received soon," WHO Chief Scientist Soumya Swaminathan said. Earlier, reports said WHO approval was likely in 24 hours.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: China's new COVID-19 outbreak wipes $4 billion off hot pot chain's value in 3 days
text: China's top hot pot chain has lost $4 billion from its market value in three days after the government increased curbs following a new COVID-19 outbreak. Haidilao International Holding's shares have declined 20% this week, as of Wednesday, making it Hong Kong's Hang Seng Index's worst performer. A government official said that new infections will increase in the coming days.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Shiba Inu jumps 40% to record high after anonymous buyer purchases 277 billion tokens
text: Meme-based cryptocurrency Shiba Inu (SHIB) jumped over 40% to hit a fresh all-time high and was trading at $0.0000593 on Wednesday, according to CoinMarketCap. The rally was driven by the news of an anonymous crypto whale purchasing 277 billion SHIB worth about $11.5 million on Monday. SHIB is currently the world's 11th largest cryptocurrency by market value.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Wow, 13 years ago: Musk on old video from when Tesla was nearly out of cash
text: Tesla CEO and the world's richest person Elon Musk tweeted, "Wow, 13 years ago," in response to his old video taken at the time when Tesla was nearly out of cash. In the video, Musk claimed that he earned "minimum wage" from Tesla. On Monday, Tesla achieved $1 trillion market capitalisation, making Musk $36 billion richer in a day.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: How many years did it take for various companies to hit the $1 trillion m-cap mark?
text: Tesla took 18 years to hit the $1-trillion m-cap milestone, the world's second-fastest company to do so. Facebook was the fastest after taking 17 years, but it briefly hit the $1-trillion mark. Amazon took 24 years to hit $1 trillion, Apple took 42 years, Microsoft took 44 years and Alphabet hit $1 trillion m-cap 21 years after Google's inception.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Had 6 months of cash left, IPO was a desperate contingency plan: Zomato CEO
text: Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal told ET that the food delivery platform's ₹9,375-crore IPO in July was "a desperate contingency plan". "We saw a 90% drop in business after the first COVID-19 wave and...had six months of money left in the bank," Goyal revealed. We really needed to "raise $50 million" (₹374 crore) irrespective of whether we were undervalued, he said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Govt sends 202 notices to e-comm firms in a year for violating 'country of origin' rule
text: The government issued 202 notices to e-commerce players for incorrect declaration of 'country of origin' on products on their platforms in the last one year. The maximum number of such violations were found with respect to electronic appliances, followed by clothing and home products. Another 15 notices were issued for incorrect expiry date, charging more than MRP and other reasons.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Paytm to open India's biggest ever IPO on November 8, will raise ₹18,300 crore
text: Paytm's parent company One97 Communications will open its IPO for subscription from November 8-10 to raise ₹18,300 crore. The IPO comprises a fresh issue of ₹8,300 crore and an offer for sale of up to ₹10,000 crore by existing shareholders. Founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma will sell shares worth ₹402.65 crore. Paytm's IPO will be India's biggest ever public issue.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Made peace with the fact Zerodha might not even exist after 5 yrs: CEO on competition
text: Zerodha's CEO Nithin Kamath at YourStory's event TechSparks said, "I've made peace with the worst-case out...Five years down the line, Zerodha may not even exist because competition destroys us." He added, "It's been good times for us...but there are competitors who will catch up with us." He also advised founders to build sustainable and resilient businesses instead of chasing valuations.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Paytm to raise size of India's biggest IPO to ₹18,300 crore: Reports
text: Paytm's parent company One97 Communications is planning to increase the size of the company's initial public offering (IPO) to ₹18,300 crore, reports said. The offer for sale size will reportedly increase to ₹10,000 crore and Ant Group may sell nearly ₹5,000 crore worth of shares. Earlier, Paytm filed papers for a ₹16,600-crore IPO, making it India's biggest ever public issue.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Swiss Re to buy 23% stake in Paytm Insuretech for about ₹920 crore
text: Paytm on Wednesday announced that Switzerland-based reinsurance firm Swiss Re will buy a 23% stake in its insurance unit, Paytm Insuretech, for about ₹920 crore. Swiss Re will invest by way of equity shares and compulsorily convertible preference shares, it added. Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma will also make an investment in Paytm Insuretech along with Swiss Re.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Policybazaar fixes price band for its IPO at ₹940-980 per share
text: PB Fintech, the operator of online insurance aggregator Policybazaar, has fixed the price band for its initial public offering (IPO) at ₹940-980 per share. The offer will open for subscription on November 1 and close on November 3. It comprises a fresh issue of ₹3,750 crore and an offer-for-sale of ₹1959.72 crore by its existing shareholders and promoters.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Petrol, diesel prices hit all-time highs; petrol nears ₹114 per litre in Mumbai
text: Petrol and diesel prices hit fresh record highs on Wednesday after the fuel rates were hiked following a two-day pause. A 35 paise hike took petrol price in Delhi to ₹107.94 per litre and diesel price to ₹96.67. In Mumbai, a litre of petrol is retailing at ₹113.80 per litre after a 34 paise hike, while diesel now costs ₹104.75.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Ambani's Reliance Industries submits EoI for Armani's fabric supplier Sintex: Report
text: Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries has reportedly submitted an expression of interest (EoI) along with Assets Care & Reconstruction Enterprise (ACRE) for Gujarat-based Sintex Industries. The company, which supplies fabric to Armani, Hugo Boss and others, was admitted to the insolvency process earlier this year. At least three banks, including PNB, had declared the firm's account as fraud.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: US revokes top Chinese telecom firm's licence, cites national security risk
text: The US Federal Communications Commission (FCC) has voted to revoke Chinese government-owned China Telecom's licence in US, citing "national security and law enforcement risks". China Telecom, which is one of China's largest telecommunications company, will have to discontinue US services within 60 days. China Telecom has had authorisation to provide telecom services for nearly 20 years in the US.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: IMF's Gita Gopinath tweets pre-Diwali pic with Raghuram Rajan, Abhijit Banerjee
text: IMF Chief Economist Gita Gopinath shared a picture on Twitter with former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan and Nobel laureates Esther Duflo and Abhijit Banerjee from their pre-Diwali celebrations. Several Twitter users responded to the picture with one saying, "That's some serious firecracker brainpower in one room." "Probably the most intelligent square meter in the world right there," another said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Govt to pitch to Tesla, Samsung for local battery production: Report
text: The government is planning to pitch to companies such as Tesla, Samsung and LG Energy to encourage them to invest in manufacturing batteries locally, Reuters reported quoting government sources. India will reportedly host five roadshows starting next month in several countries to convince battery makers to set up local production. It includes countries like US, Germany, France, South Korea, Japan.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: 1,00,000 Tesla cars sold to Hertz at same price as to consumers: Musk
text: After US car rental company Hertz's order for 1,00,000 Tesla cars led to a surge in Tesla's stock price, CEO Elon Musk said, "To be clear, cars sold to Hertz have no discount. Same price as to consumers." Tesla's market capitalisation also surpassed $1 trillion. "Strange that moved valuation, as Tesla is very much a production ramp problem," Musk noted.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Jaguar Land Rover extends production cuts amid chip shortage: Report
text: Tata Motors-owned Jaguar Land Rover has decided to extend production cuts in the current quarter amid the global semiconductor chip shortage, The Economic Times reported. It has scheduled production shutdown at its Nitra and Solihull plants, while the plant in Graz will also witness no-production days, it added. This may result in an incremental revenue loss of about ₹3,100-3,350 crore.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Jack Ma visits Dutch institutes involved in agritech: Report
text: Alibaba Founder Jack Ma has been touring Dutch research institutions to pursue his interests in agriculture technology, SCMP reported. He will continue touring European firms and research institutions involved in agricultural infrastructure and plant breeding. Ma believes combining the technology he researched with Alibaba's cloud computing, big data analysis and AI could help Chinese agriculture.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Fino Payments Bank won't require capital raising for 2 yrs after IPO: MD
text: Fino Payments Bank MD and CEO Rishi Gupta said the firm wouldn't require further capital raising for the next couple of years post its initial public offering (IPO). "This is based on the model, planning and the transaction-oriented approach which we'll take in...next couple of years," he added. Its ₹1,200 crore IPO will open for subscription on October 29.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Govt plans to complete privatisation of 13 airports by March: AAI Chairman
text: Airports Authority of India (AAI) Chairman Sanjeev Kumar said the Centre plans to complete privatisation process for 13 airports by the end of March. "We've sent a list of 13 airports to...Aviation Ministry that are to be bid out on PPP," he told The Economic Times. The model for bidding would be based on per-passenger revenue model, he added.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: ₹150 cr unaccounted income detected after raid on Punjab-based group
text: The Ministry of Finance said that the Income Tax Department has detected unaccounted income of about ₹150 crore after raid on a group engaged in cycle business in Punjab. Cash worth ₹2.25 crore and unaccounted gold worth ₹2 crore was also seized. It also detected ₹40 crore unaccounted income from Jalandhar-based group involved in immigration and visa services for students.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Kotak, Axis, IndusInd submit bids to buy Citi’s India consumer biz: Report
text: Kotak Mahindra Bank, Axis Bank and IndusInd Bank have made binding offers to buy Citi's consumer business in India, valued at about $2 billion, The Economic Times reported. Citi is expected to announce a formal winner in the next one-two months, it added. In April, the company had announced it will exit consumer banking business in 13 countries, including India.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: RBI fines Vasai Vikas Sahakari Bank ₹90 lakh for non-compliance
text: The RBI on Tuesday said that it has imposed a penalty of ₹90 lakh on Vasai Vikas Sahakari Bank, Maharashtra. "This action is based on deficiency in regulatory compliance," it added. The bank had not complied with its directions, including on ensuring end-use of funds in borrowal accounts and classification of loans, advances as non-performing assets, RBI said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: India's Covaxin may get WHO approval in next 24 hours: Spokesperson
text: A WHO technical advisory group which met on Tuesday to consider Bharat Biotech's COVID-19 vaccine Covaxin for emergency use listing is likely to announce its decision soon. "If all is in place and all goes well and if the committee is satisfied, we would expect a recommendation within the next 24 hours or so," WHO spokesperson Margaret Harris told reporters.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: List of all the bidders and their amounts for 2 new IPL teams surfaces
text: List of all the bidders and their amounts for two new IPL teams has surfaced. The list shows RPSG Ventures Limited bid ₹7,090 crore for both Ahmedabad and Lucknow teams and went for Lucknow. Adani Group bid ₹5,100 crore for Ahmedabad but were beaten by CVC Capital, who bid ₹5,625 crore. RPSG also bid for Indore for ₹4,790 crore.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: World's richest person Elon Musk's wealth jumps $36 billion in 1 day
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's wealth surged by more than $36 billion in a day after American car rental company Hertz placed an order for 100,000 Tesla cars. With this, the world's richest person's net worth touched $288.6 billion, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Musk is now worth more than ExxonMobil, which has a market value of $272.4 billion.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Elon Musk tweets 'Wild $T1mes' after Tesla hits $1 trillion market cap
text: Tesla CEO and the world's richest person Elon Musk tweeted "Wild $T1mes" after his electric carmaking company hit $1 trillion in market capitalisation for the first time. On Monday, Tesla shares surged 14.9% to $1,045.02 after American car rental company Hertz ordered 1,00,000 Tesla cars. Musk got $36 billion richer in a day and his wealth surged to $289 billion.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: $4.2 billion cars deal generates $119 billion in market value for Tesla, Hertz
text: The news of American car rental company Hertz placing an order for 1,00,000 Tesla cars generated $119 billion jump in market value for the buyer and seller combined. Tesla added $118 billion, taking its total market value to over $1 trillion, while Hertz gained $1.17 billion in market value. Hertz will spend $4.2 billion on the cars, Bloomberg reported.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: I decided to support Doge as it felt like the people's crypto: Elon Musk
text: Tesla CEO and the world's richest person Elon Musk said he decided to support Doge as "it felt like the people's crypto". He added, "Lots of people I talked to on the production lines at Tesla or building rockets at SpaceX own Doge...They aren't financial experts or Silicon Valley technologists." Earlier, Musk revealed he only owns Bitcoin, Ether and Doge.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Tesla briefly surpasses $1 trillion market cap for the first time
text: Tesla on Monday briefly surpassed market capitalisation of $1 trillion for the first time ever, after its shares surged over 9.5%. The company's shares hit a record high of more than $998 after American car rental company Hertz placed an order for 1,00,000 Tesla cars. Tesla also became the second-fastest company ever to reach the $1 trillion mark, Bloomberg reported.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Samsung leader fined $60,000 over illegal use of sedative
text: Samsung Electronics leader Jay Y Lee has been fined $60,000 for his illegal substance use. Earlier this month, Lee admitted that he used propofol 41 times over a five-year span through last year. Lee's attorneys argued the sedative was used on doctors' prescriptions, adding he was under psychological pressure from the death of his father and several trials.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Which companies have $1 trillion or more market cap besides Tesla?
text: Tesla has become the latest company to surpass $1 trillion in market capitalisation. Besides Tesla, Apple, Microsoft, Amazon, Alphabet, and oil company Saudi Aramco have over $1 trillion in market cap, amongst which, Apple, Microsoft and Saudi Aramco have over $2 trillion in market cap. Facebook hit $1 trillion in market cap in mid-2021 but later slipped below the mark.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: BharatPe opposes PhonePe's trademarks for using 'Pe' in Devanagari in Delhi HC
text: BharatPe's holding firm Resilient Innovations has moved the Delhi High Court to cancel PhonePe's registrations for the 'Pe' device mark in Devanagari script. This comes after PhonePe moved Bombay High Court against BharatPe's use of 'Pe' in 'postpe' and later withdrew the petition. "We hope...PhonePe would...get a reality check, and put an end to its ill-conceived...agenda," a spokesperson said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: India spending ₹8 lakh cr on petrol, diesel imports: Gadkari amid record high prices
text: Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari said that India imports petrol and diesel worth ₹8 lakh crore and it'll increase to ₹25 lakh crore in five years if the trend of its utilisation continues. Gadkari added that "diesel and petrol aren't good for the environment" and urged people to switch to alternate fuels. His comments came amid record high fuel prices.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Spanx's CEO surprises all employees with two first-class plane tickets, $10,000 cash
text: US shapewear brand Spanx's CEO Sara Blakely is giving every employee of her company two first-class plane tickets for anywhere in the world and $10,000 cash to spend on their trip. Blakely announced the reward after Blackstone agreed to buy a majority stake in Spanx, valuing it at $1.2 billion. "I want every employee to celebrate this moment," she said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: US, Biological E finalise $50 mn financing deal for COVID-19 vaccine
text: The US and Biological E said they have finalised a financing arrangement for $50 million to expand the firm's capacity to produce COVID-19 vaccine. "Scaling Biological E new facility...will help close the vaccine gap," US International Development Finance Corporation (DFC) COO David Marchick said. It will support capacity for production of over 100 crore vaccine doses by 2022-end, he added.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Crypto fund inflows hit record $1.5 bn as US Bitcoin ETFs launched: Report
text: Investors poured a record $1.5 billion into the cryptocurrency market last week amid a rally in cryptocurrencies and the launch of the first Bitcoin ETFs in the US, CoinShares reported. The previous weekly record came in February, when inflows totalled $640 million. The year-to-date crypto inflows now total $8 billion, beating the 2020 record of $6.7 billion.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Nykaa shares trade at 60% premium in grey market ahead of its IPO
text: The unlisted shares of Nykaa's parent company FSN E-Commerce Ventures are trading at ₹1,775-1,805 apiece, a premium of up to 60%, in the grey market, according to reports. Nykaa has fixed the price band at ₹1,085-1,125 per share for its initial public offering (IPO) and is likely to raise ₹5,352 crore. The IPO will open for subscription on October 28.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Fino Payments Bank sets price band for ₹1,200 cr IPO at ₹560-577 apiece
text: Fino Payments Bank has fixed the price band for its ₹1,200 crore initial public offering (IPO) at ₹560-577 apiece. The offer comprises a fresh issue of equity shares worth ₹300 crore and an offer-for-sale of 1.56 crore shares by the promoter of the company, Fino Paytech. The IPO will open for subscription on October 29 and close on November 2.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Ant Group changed name for NFTs amid China crypto crackdown
text: Jack Ma's Ant Group changed the name for NFTs on its platform, AntChain, to "digital collectibles" in September, amid China's crack down on cryptocurrency sector. AntChain said it "firmly opposes price speculation around NFT products" and decided to use "a more accurate description" for its business. Tencent's Huanhe has also reportedly started referencing to NFTs as "digital collectibles".
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Snapdeal appoints 2 independent directors ahead of its proposed IPO
text: Snapdeal has strengthened two ESG-focussed independent directors to its board ahead of its expected ₹3,000 crore IPO. It has appointed Zomato's Chairman Kaushik Dutta and Richa Arora, who is Managing Partner & CEO for ESG Stewardship Services at ECube Investment Advisors. According to reports, the firm is considering to file its draft red herring prospectus in the next few months.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: UP 1st state to impose stock limit on edible oils: Sudhanshu Pandey
text: Uttar Pradesh has become the first state to issue a notification for setting the stock limits on edible oils, Secretary of Food and Public Distribution Department Sudhanshu Pandey said. "The main purpose...is to give maximum relief to the needy consumers," he added. "The states...started imposing stock limits...so that people can be relieved during the festive season," Pandey stated.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Adani exploring investment in Sri Lanka's renewable energy sector: Official
text: Sri Lanka's Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) Vice Chairman Nalinda Ilangakoon said the Adani Group is exploring the possibility of investing in the country's renewable energy and wind sector. Adani Group's senior officials visited Mannar to inspect the wind power farm, he added. Recently, the company struck a deal with Sri Lanka to develop and run Colombo Port's Western Container Terminal.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: SBI, UCO Bank agree to invest ₹450 cr in Amrapali projects, SC told
text: The Supreme Court was told by senior advocate and court-appointed receiver R Venkataramani that SBI and UCO Bank have agreed to invest ₹450 crore in Amrapali projects. He further said that other banks, who were part of a consortium, are delaying the process. In order to accelerate the process, a little nudge from the top court was needed, he added.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: NCGP aims at increasing capital goods' production to $101 bn by 2025: Goyal
text: Union Minister Piyush Goyal said the National Capital Goods Policy (NCGP) aims to increase the production of capital goods to $101 billion by 2025, from about $31 billion in 2014-15. The policy will also help India's textiles machinery sector to become a global player, he added. The policy also aims to raise employment in the sector to 3 crore.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: High probability of oil reaching $100 per barrel: BlackRock CEO
text: Larry Fink, CEO of the world's largest asset manager BlackRock, has said that there is a high probability of oil reaching $100 a barrel. Higher energy inflation would linger for some time due to a focus on short-term policies, he added. Fink also called for more collaboration between the public and private sectors to tackle global challenges.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: 3 Titan employees fined by SEBI for violating insider trading norms
text: SEBI has fined three employees of Titan ₹1 lakh each for violating insider trading norms. During their employment with Titan, they had transacted in securities of Titan but failed to make requisite disclosures to the firm as required under Prevention of Insider Trading norms. The disclosure requirements were triggered on account of transactions exceeding ₹10 lakh traded value, SEBI said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Bombay HC grants injunction to Zee, restrains Invesco from holding EGM
text: The Bombay High Court on Tuesday granted an injunction in favour of Zee Entertainment in its dispute against Invesco Developing Markets Fund and OFI Global China Fund. The court has restrained Invesco from calling an extraordinary general meeting (EGM). Invesco and OFI had sought an EGM to remove Zee's CEO and MD Punit Goenka and reconstitute the firm's board.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Zee cancels board meeting on quarterly results due to 'lack of quorum'
text: Zee Entertainment said it has cancelled its board meeting, which was scheduled for October 27 to consider and approve the second quarter's financial results, due to lack of quorum. Next date of the meeting will be announced with a fresh notice, it added. This comes amid the ongoing dispute between Invesco and Zee over calling for an extraordinary general meeting.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: India's inflation may jump by 1% if commodity prices remain high: Nomura
text: India's inflation may jump by 1% if commodity prices, including crude oil, continue to remain high, a research note released by brokerage firm Nomura suggested. Crude oil prices could cumulatively rise by 10% and may impact inflation by 30 basis points, it said. It'll also end up adding around 0.3% of the GDP to the current account deficit, it added.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Future yahi hai: CoinDCX in new ad film aimed at crypto awareness
text: CoinDCX, which claims to be India's safest crypto exchange, has announced the launch of its mega campaign 'Future Yahi Hai'. In a series of ad films, the campaign will feature multiple celebrities. CoinDCX hopes to dispel all myths about crypto as an asset class and educate people about how simple and safe it is to invest in. Use code SHORTS100.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: 2 new IPL teams announced; RPSG gets Lucknow team, CVC Capital claims Ahmedabad
text: RP-Sanjiv Goenka Group (RPSG Group) and Irelia Company Pte Ltd (CVC Capital) have been confirmed as the owners of the two new IPL teams. RPSG Group placed the highest bid of ₹7,090 crore and will own the team based out of Lucknow. Meanwhile, CVC Capital placed second-highest bid of ₹5,625 crore and will have their team based out of Ahmedabad.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Bitcoin price breaks past record, scales new height: CoinSwitch Kuber
text: Bitcoin touched an all-time high of above ₹50,00,000 on Wednesday after the first futures-based Bitcoin Exchange Traded Fund got listed on the New York Stock Exchange. According to India's crypto trading app Coinswitch Kuber, the crypto trading volume surged by nearly 90.78% post the all-time high while Bitcoin alone saw 108% increase in the number of trades.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Shiba Inu jumps 50% to a record high, becomes 11th largest cryptocurrency
text: Cryptocurrency Shiba Inu (SHIB), a meme coin named after the Japanese dog breed Shiba Inu, jumped 50% to a record high and was trading at $0.0000423 on Sunday. It became the 11th largest cryptocurrency by market value after Bitcoin, Ethereum, Binance Coin, Cardano, Tether, Solana, XRP, Polkadot, Dogecoin and USD Coin. SHIB has gained over 40,500,000% in the past year.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: World's richest person Elon Musk says he'll become first Dogecoin trillionaire
text: World's richest person Elon Musk on Twitter said that he'll become the first Dogecoin trillionaire. Responding to a tweet which said, "Musk is predicted to become the world's first trillionaire, thanks to SpaceX", the CEO of Tesla and SpaceX wrote, "In Dogecoin". Earlier, Musk had revealed that he personally owned Bitcoin, Ether and the meme-inspired cryptocurrency Dogecoin.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Shiba Inu falls from record high after Musk says he doesn't hold the crypto
text: Meme token Shiba Inu (SHIB) fell from a record high on Sunday night and was trading at $0.000039 after the world's richest person, Elon Musk, revealed that he doesn't hold the meme cryptocurrency. Musk responded "None" to a Twitter user who asked him how much SHIB does he own. Musk also said he only bought Bitcoin, Ether and Dogecoin.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Airtel opts for AGR dues moratorium, becomes the 2nd telco to do so: Reports
text: Bharti Airtel has opted for the four-year moratorium on the adjusted gross revenue (AGR) and spectrum payments, reports said on Monday. Airtel has become the second telecom operator to opt for the moratorium after Vodafone Idea (now Vi). The government had recently announced a deadline of October 29 for opting for the AGR dues moratorium.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Entrepreneur who sold his 1st startup to Yahoo at 17 sells his chat app to Twitter
text: Nick D'Aloisio, a 25-year-old British entrepreneur who sold his first startup 'Summly' to Yahoo when he was 17, has now sold his chat app 'Sphere' to Twitter. Co-founded in 2016 by Nick while studying at the University of Oxford, Sphere began as a real-time Q&A app before pivoting to become a group chat app. Sphere's 20 employees will join Twitter.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Alibaba loses $344 bn in a year in the world's biggest shareholder value wipeout
text: China's Alibaba has lost $344 billion in market capitalisation since last October, the biggest wipeout of shareholder value globally, Bloomberg said. Alibaba's market capitalisation began falling after Founder Jack Ma criticised China's financial system in a speech. Shortly after the criticism, China suspended Alibaba's Ant Group's $34.5-billion IPO that was set to be the world's largest.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: US car rental company Hertz orders 1,00,000 Tesla cars
text: American car rental company Hertz has placed an order for 1,00,000 Tesla cars for delivery by the end of 2022, just four months after coming out of bankruptcy. It's said to be the single largest purchase ever for electric vehicles and represents $4.4 billion of revenue for Tesla. Hertz filed for bankruptcy protection in May 2020 after travel demand sank.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Paytm CEO shares e-mail from teammate after SEBI allowed ₹16,600 crore IPO
text: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma took to Twitter to share a teammate's e-mail to him after Paytm got SEBI's approval to launch its ₹16,600 crore IPO, set to be India's biggest-ever IPO. The e-mail said, "I might be a Gilehri (squirrel) who was trying to help build ram-setu in Ramayan as I have with Paytm for close to 7 years."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Ex-flight attendants of Italian airline Alitalia strip off to protest job losses
text: Former flight attendants of the bankrupt Italian airline Alitalia stripped off their uniforms this week in central Rome to protest against job losses and pay cuts. They removed their Alitalia uniforms to stand in their underwear, chanting, "We are Alitalia." A new national airline, ITA Airways, bought the Alitalia brand and retained fewer than 3,000 of Alitalia's 10,000 employees.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Govt signs share purchase agreement with Tata Sons for Air India deal
text: The Centre on Monday signed a share purchase agreement with Tata Sons for sale of Air India for ₹18,000 crore. Earlier this month, the government had accepted Tata Sons' offer to pay ₹2,700 crore cash and take over ₹15,300 crore of the airline's debt. The deal also includes the sale of Air India Express and ground handling arm AISATS.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Matchbox price increased for the first time in 14 years, to cost ₹2 from Dec
text: Matchboxes will cost ₹2 instead of the current ₹1 per box rate from December 1, 2021, after the first hike in the price of matchboxes in 14 years. The representatives of five major matchbox industry bodies unanimously decided this due to the higher cost of raw materials. The matchbox price was last hiked in 2007 from 50p to ₹1.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Expect to roll out our COVID-19 vaccine by November-end: Biological E MD
text: Biological E MD Mahima Datla said the company is expecting its COVID-19 vaccine Corbevax to be rolled out by the end of November. Currently, the manufactured doses are being sent to Central Drugs Laboratory in Kasauli, Himachal Pradesh for regulatory testing, she added. Datla said the firm has the capacity to make 100 crore doses of Corbevax per annum.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: India wouldn't be able to make 1 bn vaccine doses without PM: SII MD
text: After Prime Minister Narendra Modi met representatives from seven Indian COVID-19 vaccine makers on Saturday, Serum Institute's MD Cyrus Poonawalla said, "Had it not been for [PM Modi] and the health ministry, today India would not have been able to make a billion [COVID-19 vaccine] doses." "He went out of the way and made everyone move very fast," Poonawalla added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Supermarket chain Tesco suffers 2-day outage after hack 'attempt'
text: Britain's biggest supermarket chain Tesco's app and website were down for a second day on Sunday, leaving shoppers unable to order goods and track deliveries. "An attempt was made to interfere with our systems, which has caused problems with the search function on the site," Tesco said. There's no reason to believe customer data had been compromised, it added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Not pursuing acquisition of Pinterest at this time: PayPal
text: PayPal has said that it is not pursuing an acquisition of Pinterest at this time. This comes after media reports stated that the firm was in talks to buy Pinterest for as much as $45 billion and had offered $70 per share, mostly in stock, for Pinterest. PayPal shares have fallen 11.5% since reports of the talks emerged.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Mahindra to sell SsangYong for $260 mn to S Korean startup: Report
text: Mahindra & Mahindra's South Korean subsidiary SsangYong Motor Company has reportedly named a consortium led by South Korean electric vehicle startup Edison Motors as its preferred bidder. The deal is estimated to be worth about $260 million, Nikkei reported. SsangYong, which was put under court receivership earlier this year, was acquired by Mahindra & Mahindra for $463 million in 2011.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Traders feel cheated by foreign-funded e-commerce companies: CAIT
text: Indian traders' body CAIT said the government has taken no meaningful action to stop the malpractices of e-commerce companies. "It is...astonishing that US Senators have taken cognisance of the malpractices by Amazon in India but so far no [Indian] government department...has taken any note," CAIT added. It also said the trading community feels cheated by foreign-funded e-commerce companies.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Turkey's Lira hits record low after Prez orders expulsion of 10 ambassadors
text: Turkey's currency, Lira, has fallen to an all-time low of 9.85 after President Tayyip Erdogan said he had ordered expulsion of ambassadors from the US and nine other Western countries. He ordered for their expulsion for demanding the release of businessman and philanthropist Osman Kavala. Lira has lost 24% against the dollar this year, the worst performer in emerging markets.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Yes Bank intends to reduce NPAs to zero by March 2022: CEO
text: Yes Bank intends to bring down its gross non-performing assets (NPAs) to zero by March 31 next year, its CEO and MD Prashant Kumar said. He added that the bank is planning to set up an asset reconstruction (ARC) company in partnership with stressed asset funds. "Once...ARC is set up, it'll take over...entire NPA pool of the bank," Kumar said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Governance at PSBs can be improved if they're managed by boards: Ex-SBI chief
text: Former SBI Chairman Rajnish Kumar said governance at public sector banks (PSBs) can be improved if they're managed by boards and regulatory gaps between private and public lenders are bridged. Kumar said his advice to the government would be to play an active shareholder's role. "It's not that accountability comes only when you've direct control (of government)...It doesn't," he added.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Dish TV's ₹1,000 cr rights issue critical for survival: Official
text: Dish TV's ₹1,000 crore rights issue is critical for the DTH company's survival, a top company official told PTI. The official said the company needs funds to upgrade technology and replace old set-top boxes with the new-age smart connected boxes otherwise its platform would start shrinking. Yes Bank, which holds 25.63% stake in Dish TV, has opposed the rights issue.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: ICICI Bank's net profit rises 30% y-o-y to ₹5,511 crore in Q2
text: ICICI Bank reported a 30% increase in standalone net profit to ₹5,511 crore for September 2021 quarter, as compared with ₹4,251 crore a year ago. The bank's net interest income (NII) for the quarter rose 25% over last year to ₹11,690 crore. ICICI Bank's provisions (excluding provision for tax) declined 9% to ₹2,714 crore from ₹2,995 crore a year ago.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: China's Evergrande Group resumes work on more than 10 projects
text: China's Evergrande Group has resumed work on more than 10 projects in six cities including Shenzhen, the company said on Sunday. The development comes after the company reportedly made a key interest payment of $83.5 million last week, averting default. China's second-largest property developer had earlier suspended some projects because of delays in payment to suppliers and contractors.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: ICICI Bank shares rise 11% as it posts highest ever net profit in Q2
text: ICICI Bank's shares surged 11.52% to close at ₹846.75 on the NSE after it reported its highest-ever quarterly profit on standalone basis. The bank reported a 30% rise in standalone net profit to ₹5,511 crore for the July-September quarter. "There are no exceptional items during this period because we haven't sold anything (from subsidiaries)," its Executive Director Sandeep Batra said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Tesla will get all tax benefits it wants: Niti Aayog Vice Chairman
text: Niti Aayog Vice Chairman Rajiv Kumar urged Elon Musk-led Tesla to "come and manufacture" in India. "You (Tesla) will get all the tax benefits you want. The argument that we'll create a market by exporting into India finished products...is an old argument," he added. Earlier, reports said Tesla urged PM Narendra Modi's office to slash import taxes on electric vehicles.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: $26.6 billion wiped off Intel's market value in a day post 3rd-quarter earnings
text: Intel lost around $26.6 billion in market capitalisation on Friday after the chipmaker reported that a global chip shortage impacted its third-quarter revenue. The stock fell by 12%, its biggest decline since July 2020, cutting the firm's market capitalisation to $201 billion. For the first time, Intel's market capitalisation is lesser than Broadcom, whose market valuation is above $212 billion.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: PhonePe files, then withdraws suit against BharatPe for using 'Pe' suffix in 'postpe'
text: Amid ongoing dispute between payments companies PhonePe and BharatPe over the usage of 'Pe' suffix, PhonePe recently moved Bombay High Court against BharatPe for using the suffix in 'PostPe/postpe'. BharatPe launched 'postpe' on October 6. However, PhonePe said it has withdrawn the suit to address certain observations made by the court, adding, "We will, accordingly, file a fresh suit."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Elon Musk's net worth crosses $250 billion as Tesla shares hit record highs
text: World's richest person Elon Musk's net worth crossed $250 billion as shares of Tesla hit fresh all-time highs on Friday. The electric car maker's stock closed at around $910 per share, taking its market value to more than $900 billion for the first time ever. Musk reportedly has a stake of more than 20% in Tesla.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Nykaa Founder Falguni, family's net worth to rise to $3.5 billion with IPO: Report
text: The combined net worth of Nykaa Founder Falguni Nayar and her family may rise to $3.5 billion with the Mumbai-based fashion and beauty e-commerce platform's IPO, Bloomberg reported. The company is reportedly seeking a valuation of $7 billion through the IPO, which will open on October 28. It will raise over ₹5,350 crore (around $714 million) through the share sale.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Paytm gets SEBI's approval for ₹16,600-cr IPO, India's biggest public issue: Reports
text: Paytm's parent company One97 Communications has received approval from Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) for its ₹16,600-crore initial public offering (IPO), according to reports. While ₹8,300 crore will be primary share sale, ₹8,300 crore will be an offer for sale (OFS), where existing investors can sell their shares. This will be India's biggest public issue so far.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Future Retail's plea on halt of ₹24,713 crore Reliance deal rejected by arbitrator
text: A Singapore arbitration panel has rejected Future Retail's plea to quash an order from October 2020 that put its ₹24,713 crore deal with Reliance Industries on hold. Amazon, which accused Kishore Biyani-led Future Group of violating a 2019 contract, had won an injunction from the panel. Earlier, the Supreme Court held that the arbitrator's order was valid under Indian laws.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Nykaa fixes IPO price band at ₹1,085-1,125 per share, will raise over ₹5,350 crore
text: Nykaa has fixed the price band for its over ₹5,350-crore IPO, which will open for subscription on October 28, at ₹1,085-1,125 per share. The IPO comprises a fresh issue of ₹630 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 4.197 crore equity shares by the promoters and investors. Founded in 2012 by Falguni Nayar, the startup turned unicorn in 2020.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Petrol, diesel prices hiked for 4th day in a row; diesel hits ₹100/litre in Chennai
text: Petrol and diesel prices were hiked for the fourth consecutive day on Saturday to touch all-time highs across the country. With the latest hike, Chennai became the second metro city to see diesel price cross ₹100 per litre mark, while petrol is retailing at ₹104.22 there. In Delhi, petrol now costs ₹107.24 per litre, while diesel price rose to ₹95.97.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Swiggy announces 2-day paid period leaves per month for female delivery agents
text: Online food delivery platform Swiggy has introduced a "no-questions-asked, two-day paid monthly period time-off policy" for its women delivery partners. Swiggy's Vice President of Operations Mihir Shah said the policy is completely voluntary and ensures that those who opt for it are still eligible for a minimum earnings guarantee for that duration. Swiggy has nearly 1,000 female delivery agents.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: In which cities has petrol price crossed ₹110 per litre?
text: Petrol price has crossed ₹110 per litre in cities including Sri Ganganagar, Bhopal, Jaipur and Hyderabad, as hikes in prices have pushed petrol and diesel rates to record highs across the country. In Mumbai, petrol and diesel prices per litre stand at ₹113.12 and ₹104.00 respectively. Petrol price is also above ₹110 per litre in Bengaluru and Patna.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Ex-Deutsche Bank worker given $200 mn reward for Libor-rigging tip: Reports
text: A US regulator has reportedly given a record reward of almost $200 million to a former Deutsche Bank employee who raised concerns about the rigging of the Libor interest rate benchmark. The reward was reportedly announced by US CFTC and marks the largest-ever payment under the whistleblower program. The German bank paid a $2.5-billion fine in 2015 to American authorities.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: 78-yr-old multi-millionaire real estate heir charged for wife's murder after 40 yrs
text: Multi-millionaire real estate heir Robert Durst has been charged with murder in the death of his first wife Kathleen Durst, nearly four decades after she disappeared. Kathleen, then 29, disappeared in January 1982 and her body was never found. Earlier this month, 78-year-old Robert was sentenced to life in prison for murdering his best friend Susan Berman in 2000.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: World's top oil exporter Saudi Arabia says it'll become carbon neutral by 2060
text: Ahead of the COP26 climate talks, Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman on Saturday pledged to reduce the world's top oil exporter's net carbon emissions to zero by 2060. The country will aim to cut carbon emissions by 278 million tonnes per year by 2030, he said. Saudi Arabia has the highest carbon-dioxide emissions per capita among G-20 countries.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Reliance Industries' net profit rises 43% to ₹13,680 crore in September quarter
text: Reliance Industries on Friday reported that its consolidated net profit increased 42.99% to ₹13,680 crore in the July-September quarter from ₹9,567 crore a year ago. The company's revenue from operations jumped by 49.8% to ₹1.74 lakh crore in the quarter from previous years' ₹1.16 lakh crore. Jio Platforms' revenue rose to ₹19,777 crore from ₹18,496 crore in the year-ago quarter.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Reliance Retail net profit rises 74% to ₹1,695 crore in Q2
text: Reliance Retail, the retail arm of Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries, on Friday posted 74% growth in net profit in the July-September quarter to ₹1,695 crore as against previous year's ₹973 crore. The company's revenue jumped 18% to ₹45,426 crore in the quarter as compared to ₹41,100 crore in the year-ago period. Both profit and revenue stood above pre-COVID-19 levels.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Govt, RBI did superb job: Mahindra as Yes Bank posts ₹225 cr profit in Q2
text: Mahindra Group's Chairman Anand Mahindra praised the government and the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) after Yes Bank reported a 74.3% year-on-year increase in net profit to ₹225 crore for the quarter ended September. "We have to acknowledge that government and RBI did a superb job of damage control and restoration of operational normalcy for this troubled bank," Mahindra tweeted.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: China's 'Lipstick King' livestreamer sells record $1.9 billion in goods in 12 hours
text: China's livestream salesman Li Jiaqi, widely known as 'Lipstick Brother' or 'Lipstick King', sold a record $1.9 billion in goods on the first day of Alibaba's Singles Day Shopping Festival. Li, who got the nickname by trying makeup products on his show, sold products ranging from Shiseido skincare to Apple's AirPods during the 12-hour livestream. He clocked 250 million views.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Committed to our robot business: SoftBank on selling French unit
text: Japan's SoftBank in response to a report about the group selling its French robotic unit, which is behind its 'Pepper' robot, said it's committed to the 'Pepper' business. A Reuters report has claimed that SoftBank may sell its Paris-based robotics unit to Germany's United Robotics Group. Earlier, SoftBank had denied reports of the company stopping the production of 'Pepper'.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Walmart lets customers buy Bitcoin from 200 kiosks in US stores
text: Walmart has started a pilot programme under which it's letting its customers buy Bitcoin using ATM-like machines installed by Coinstar at some of its US stores. The pilot includes 200 kiosks in Walmart stores. Coinstar has partnered with digital currency exchange Coinme to let customers buy Bitcoin at some kiosks.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: US SPAC shares jump 357% on plans to merge with Trump's media firm
text: The stock price of US-based SPAC Digital World Acquisition surged nearly 357% on Thursday after its deal to take former US President Donald Trump's new media company public was announced. DWAC was the most-traded stock in the US equity market, according to TradingView data. Trump plans to launch a new social media network, 'TRUTH Social'.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Trump-linked US SPAC shares soar for 2nd day, end 107% higher
text: Shares of US-based Digital World Acquisition, the SPAC taking former US President Donald Trump's media firm public, soared for a second day on Friday and skyrocketed 284% at one point before closing up at 107%. The rally brought the SPAC's two-day gains to more than 800%. Earlier on Thursday, the firm's shares had risen by 357%.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: 3rd juror dismissed in fraud-accused Theranos Founder's trial in weeks
text: A third juror has been dismissed from fraud-accused Theranos' Founder Elizabeth Holmes' criminal trial, that started weeks ago in the US, and has been replaced with a female alternate. The trial is now reportedly going ahead with 12 jurors and two alternates, down from a total of 17 originally. The dismissed juror reportedly admitted to playing Sudoku during testimony.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Tesla shares hit record high, market cap rises above $900 billion
text: The shares of electric car maker Tesla hit an all-time high of $903.32 on Friday, bringing its market capitalisation to about $903 billion. This comes after the company reported record revenue and profits in the third quarter despite a global semiconductor shortage. Led by the world's richest person Elon Musk, Tesla is the sixth biggest publicly listed company in US.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: RBI caps IPO funding by NBFCs at ₹1 cr per borrower
text: The RBI announced a revised regulatory framework for NBFCs under which they will not be able to lend over ₹1 crore to investors seeking to buy stocks in IPO from April 1, 2022. "NBFCs can fix more conservative limits," the central bank said in a note. The new rules reportedly would not apply to upcoming IPOs of Paytm and Nykaa.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Taxes on petrol, diesel funded COVID-19 vaccines, free meals: Puri
text: Union Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri has said that taxes levied on petrol and diesel have helped fund government schemes like free COVID-19 vaccines, free meals and cooking gas to crores of people. "That ₹32 a litre we collect provides us with the ability to provide...welfare services," Puri said, adding that cutting taxes is akin to "axing one's own feet".
author: Hiral Goyal
